Bake in a 325° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till a knife inserted near centers comes out clean. Serves 4.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Spinach-Egg Casserole
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
English muffins, split and toasted, or toast points

instructions.text: For sauce, in a medium saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Measure 2/3 cup sauce; set aside. Stir spinach and ham into sauce in the saucepan. Pour into a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Place eggs atop mixture, pressing lightly. Pour reserved sauce over eggs. Bake in a 350° oven about 30 minutes or till heated through. Serve over muffins or toast.

notes: To make ahead: Prepare as above, except do not bake. Cover casserole and refrigerate 2 to 24 hours. Bake, covered, in a 350° oven for 50 to 55 minutes or till heated through.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Breakfast Pizza
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: desired vegetables (sliced pitted ripe olives; sliced avocado, green onion, or mushrooms; or chopped tomato)
shredded cheddar, Swiss, or mozzarella cheese; diced fully cooked ham; or chopped cooked turkey or chicken

instructions.text: For crust, unroll crescent rolls; separate into triangles. Place triangles on a lightly greased 12-inch pizza pan with points toward center. Press triangles together to cover bottom and 1/2 inch up sides of pan. Bake in a 375° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till lightly browned. (Do not remove crust from the oven.)

Meanwhile, combine beaten eggs, milk, oregano, and pepper. When crust is lightly browned, leave on oven shelf (if necessary, press down any high spots in crust). Carefully pour egg mixture onto crust. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes more or till egg mixture is almost set.
Sprinkle with desired vegetables. Sprinkle with cheese, ham, turkey, or chicken. Return to the oven and bake 3 to 5 minutes more or till cheese melts. Cut into wedges.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheesy Brunch Roll-Ups
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook mushrooms, onion, and green pepper in margarine till tender. Drain. Dividing mushroom mixture evenly, spoon along center of each tortilla. Divide the 1 1/2 cups cheese among the tortillas. Roll up tortillas and place, seam side down, in a greased 12x7 1/2x2-inch baking dish. In a bowl stir together eggs, milk, flour, garlic powder, and pepper sauce. Pour over rolled-up tortillas.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till set. Sprinkle the 1/2 cup cheese over top. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into 6 squares.

notes: To make ahead: Prepare as above, except do not bake. Cover and refrigerate 2 to 24 hours. Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 45 to 50 minutes or till set.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Welsh Rarebit Breakfast
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The tangy cheese sauce also is good served over broccoli, cauliflower, and burgers.

ingredients.item: English muffins, split and toasted, or 4 slices bread, toasted
slices Canadian-style bacon, warmed, or 4 poached eggs (see recipe, page 144)
shredded cheddar or American cheese (6 ounces)

instructions.text: For English muffin or toast stacks, place muffin halves or toast slices on plates. Top each with a slice of Canadian-style bacon, then a tomato slice; or, if using poached eggs, top muffins or toast with tomato slices, then eggs. Set aside.
For cheese sauce, in a heavy medium saucepan combine cheese, milk, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and red pepper. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, till cheese melts.
Slowly stir about half of the hot cheese sauce into beaten egg; return all to the saucepan. Cook and stir over low heat till cheese sauce thickens slightly and just bubbles.
Serve cheese sauce immediately over English muffin or toast stacks.

notes: Beer Rarebit: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 slices crisp-cooked bacon, drained and halved crosswise, for the Canadian-style bacon or poached eggs. Substitute beer for the milk.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marky's Blue-Eyed Muffins
recipes.description: Blueberry muffins with a cinnamon crumble topping.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars until light. Beat in egg.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Alternately with milk, add to creamed mixture. Do not over-mix.
Fold in blueberries. Spoon mixture into greased muffin pans.
To prepare topping, combine sugar, flour and cinnamon. Cut in butter.
Sprinkle topping evenly over muffin batter.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes. Cool for 1 minute. Remove from pans.

notes: Good served with fresh pineapple and hot coffee or tea.

recipes.title: Grandma's Wheat Berrie Muffins
recipes.description: Healthy muffins with wheat flour, blueberries and sunflower seeds.

instructions.text: Mix together: eggs, sugar, butter/margarine, extract.
Add to egg mix: flour, baking powder, salt. Add to another bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir in blueberries.
Stir in sunflower seeds.
Fill muffin cups 3/4 full.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

recipes.title: Spiced Blueberry Jam
recipes.description: Homemade blueberry jam with warm spices.

ingredients.prep_note: or 1 pkg (1 lb) frozen blueberries, thawed

instructions.text: Remove any stems from berries. Crush fruit, 1/2 cup at a time. Measure 2-1/4 cups, packed solidly. If necessary, add water to make up amount. Pour into very large saucepan or Dutch oven.
Add lemon juice, sugar and spices. Mix well. Bring to a rolling boil (a boil that can't be stirred down). Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Immediately stir in pectin.
Ladle into hot jelly glasses or jars. Pour 1/8-inch hot paraffin over top. Paraffin should cling to sides of jars and contain no air bubbles.
Cover with lids. Store in cool, dry place.

notes: Tips: If using fresh blueberries, carefully rinse under cold running water, drain and plump berries.

recipes.title: Maple Pecan Waffles

instructions.text: In bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
In mixing bowl, beat together egg yolks, milk and oil until combined. Gradually add flour mixture, beating after each addition. Beat only until smooth.
In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold whites into batter. Stir in pecans and maple extract.
For each waffle, pour up to 3/4 cup batter into center of waffle iron until it spreads to 1 inch from edges.
Cook until waffle iron stops steaming. Waffle should be crisp and golden. Serve immediately.
Garnish with sliced strawberries. Serve with warmed maple syrup and melted butter.

notes: Any leftover waffles can be frozen. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap or seal in a plastic bag and freeze. Reheat frozen waffles in toaster.

recipes.title: Quiche Crepes
recipes.description: Individual quiches baked in delicate crepes with bacon and Swiss cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: each salt, white pepper and nutmeg

instructions.text: To make batter for crepes, combine egg, milk and water. Blend well. Add flour.
To make crepes: In 1-cup souffle dishes, allowing them to line souffle dish, place crepes in 1-cup souffle dishes. Saute until tender.
In a bowl, beat together remaining ingredients. Pour an equal amount into each crepe. Place dishes on baking sheet.
Place crepes in 1-cup souffle dishes. Cover and refrigerate.
Assemble broccoli dish. Refrigerate.
Place pan in upper third of oven. Bake at 375°F for 25 to 30 minutes until puffed and browned.

notes: Crepes can be served from dish. To remove from dish, loosen with knife tip

assumptions: finely minced onion: used default unit

recipes.title: Buttermilk Pancakes
recipes.description: Classic buttermilk pancakes - a breakfast staple.

instructions.text: Preheat a non-stick griddle to 400°F.
Mix all ingredients together to make batter.
Pour on hot griddle in small circular amounts. When pancakes start lightly bubbling, they are ready to flip.
Serve hot with warmed syrup, butter, jam or peanut butter.

recipes.title: Blueberry Pancakes
recipes.description: Fluffy pancakes studded with fresh blueberries.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle to high.
Mix all ingredients to make the batter.
Cook on hot griddle. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Whole Grain Pancakes with Blueberry Sauce
recipes.description: Hearty whole grain pancakes topped with homemade blueberry sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat a lightly greased pancake griddle or a large skillet.
Mix all pancake ingredients together. Cook on the hot griddle.
For the sauce: Combine the sauce ingredients in a medium pan; cook over medium high heat, stirring frequently.
Sauce should gradually thicken. Serve hot over pancakes.
Mix all ingredients together with a whisk.
Cook on a preheated lightly greased griddle or skillet.
Flip when bubbles begin to form on one side.
Serve hot with butter and warmed maple syrup.

recipes.title: German Pancakes
recipes.description: A puffy oven-baked pancake with lemon - also known as a Dutch Baby.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place shortening in a large cast iron skillet and place in oven for about 7 minutes.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, salt and sugar.
In another bowl, bring together the butter, eggs, milk and vanilla. Add the juice and zest of one lemon.
Place batter in greased skillet and bake for about 20-25 minutes, until the pancake puffs up.
Remove from oven and loosen the pancake with a spatula.
Place the pancake on a large plate. Dust with powdered sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest. Serve immediately.
Preheat a pancake griddle.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Cook on the preheated griddle.
Serve hot with butter and warmed syrup.

recipes.title: Silver Dollars
recipes.description: Mini pancakes perfect for little hands.

instructions.text: Preheat a pancake griddle to high. Spray lightly with cooking spray.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Using a 1/4 cup measuring cup, drop batter onto griddle. Cook until batter begins to bubble and then flip to cook on the other side.
Serve immediately with soft butter and warmed syrup.

recipes.title: Two Berry Pancakes
recipes.description: Pancakes loaded with blueberries and strawberries, served with a fresh berry sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat a pancake griddle or a large cast iron pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, 2 tablespoons of sugar and the salt.
Add the eggs, buttermilk, vanilla and butter.
Fold in the blueberries.
Grill on the preheated griddle.
For the sauce: combine strawberries, remaining sugar, water, lemon juice, zest and cornstarch in a pan. Cook over medium heat until thickened.
Serve pancakes hot with berry sauce.
Preheat a pancake griddle.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Whisk together until well combined. Cook pancakes and serve hot with butter, warmed syrup and a sprinkle of powdered sugar if desired.
Preheat a greased griddle to high.
Combine all ingredients, whisking to combine.
Cook pancakes, about 2 minutes on each side.
Serve hot with warmed syrup, butter, jam or peanut butter.
Combine all ingredients and cook on a preheated greased griddle.
Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toast the nuts by spreading them out on a lightly greased cookie sheet.
Melt the butter and cinnamon in the microwave and drizzle over pecans. Toast for about 10-15 minutes or until they lightly browned and crispy.
Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar with a whisk.
Stir in the eggs, milk and oil.
Fold in the blueberries.
Drop pancake batter on griddle, about 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Top pancakes with toasted cinnamon pecans.
Combine all ingredients and whisk together.
Cook on a hot griddle. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients and cook pancakes on a hot griddle.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Monkey Pancakes
recipes.description: Banana chocolate chip pancakes - a kid favorite!

instructions.text: Heat a large skillet or pancake griddle.
Combine ingredients with a whisk, folding in chocolate chips with a spatula.
Cook pancakes.
Drizzle tops of pancakes with honey, maple syrup and peanut butter.

recipes.title: Cornmeal and Berry Pancakes
recipes.description: Cornmeal pancakes served with honey butter and fresh berries.

instructions.text: Preheat a greased griddle.
In a medium bowl, mix the flour, cornmeal, salt and baking powder with a whisk.
In another bowl combine the eggs with the applesauce.
Add the oil and milk to the egg mixture.
Combine the wet ingredients into the dry.
Cook the pancakes on the griddle. In a small bowl, stir the honey and butter together.
Melt the honey butter in the microwave for 20 seconds or until melted and smooth.
Serve pancakes hot with honey butter and fresh berries.
Preheat an oven to 400°F.
Spread pecans out on a baking sheet.
Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly toasted.
In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
Cook pancakes and serve hot with syrup, jam or peanut butter.

recipes.title: Autumn Spiced Pumpkin Pancakes
recipes.description: Whole wheat pancakes with warm fall spices, topped with apple butter.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle with butter.
Combine the flours, baking powder, salt and spices in a medium bowl.
Whisk in the eggs, vanilla and milk.
Grill up the pancakes on the preheated griddle.
Top with warmed apple butter and serve.

recipes.title: Healthy Apple Wheat Pancakes
recipes.description: Whole wheat pancakes with fresh apples and honey, served with sugar-free jam.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle or skillet.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt.
In another bowl whisk together the eggs and honey.
Add the vegetable oil, applesauce, cinnamon and milk.
Stir together the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients.
Fold in the apples.
Grill the pancakes and serve immediately with sugar free jam.
Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and whisk together.
Preheat a skillet and coat with cooking spray.
Cook pancakes and serve hot with your favorite syrup.
Preheat a non-stick griddle.
Combine batter ingredients and cook pancakes. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Oven Apple Pancakes
recipes.description: A great hassle-free pancake breakfast.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Add the butter to a 13x9-inch ovenproof dish and place in the oven until the butter melts. Remove the dish from the oven and swirl the butter around so that the entire base of the dish is coated.
Add the apples to the dish, spreading them out evenly. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and bake until the apple slices start to soften slightly, about ten minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl whisk together the milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt. Add the flour and keep whisking until the batter is smooth.
Pour the batter over the apples and bake for a further 20 minutes, until the pancake is puffed and golden brown.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with syrup and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Cook on a lightly greased Belgium waffle maker for about 5 to 8 minutes.
Serve hot with butter and maple syrup.

recipes.title: Waffles with Strawberries and Whip Cream

instructions.text: Heat and lightly grease a waffle maker.
Whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add in the eggs, buttermilk and butter and mix until combined.
Pour batter on the waffle maker.
Cook for about 5 to 8 minutes.
Top waffles with whip cream, fresh strawberries and a sprinkle of lemon zest. Serve immediately.
Preheat a waffle maker.
Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, 2 tablespoons of sugar, milk, eggs and butter.
Combine all berries together and mix with remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar; set aside.
Grill the waffles.
Top with sugared berries. Serve immediately.
Preheat a griddle.
Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar and salt.
Whisk in the eggs, oil and buttermilk.
Fold in the peaches. In another bowl, beat the cream with the vanilla with an electric mixer until peaks form; set aside.
Cook the pancakes. Serve hot with whip cream on the top.

recipes.title: Yeast Waffles
recipes.description: These waffles require a bit of extra effort as the batter needs to be chilled overnight but the results are so worth it, a light and fluffy yet crisp waffle.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and chill overnight.
The next morning, cook waffles in preheated waffle iron until golden.

notes: Batter must be chilled overnight for best results.

recipes.title: Bananas Foster Waffles
recipes.description: Light and crunchy waffles topped with sweet banana come together beautifully.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.

For the topping: In a saucepan, mix butter, sugar, all spice, maple syrup and rum extract (if using). Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the bananas, coating them with the sauce and cook for a further 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
To serve, spoon the banana mixture over each waffle and garnish with the pecans.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with a dollop of whipped cream over the top.

recipes.title: Anise Waffles
recipes.description: Anise lends a wonderful licorice-like flavor to these unique waffles.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and anise extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Sprinkle with powdered sugar to serve.

recipes.title: Maple Walnut Waffles
recipes.description: Crispy on the outside, soft and full of maple flavor on the inside, these waffles are sure to go down a treat.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and maple syrup. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Fold in the walnuts.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.

recipes.title: Apple Cinnamon Waffles
recipes.description: Lightly spiced apple waffles sure to become a family favorite.

ingredients.item: granny smith apples, peeled and grated

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, cinnamon and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Fold in the grated apple.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve topped with apple chunks sautéed in butter.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

instructions.text: Preheat a medium skillet to medium high. Coat pan with cooking spray.
Combine the flour and eggs together in a medium bowl. Alternately add the milk and water. Stir in the salt and butter until well combined.
Measure about 1/4 cup of batter and place in hot skillet.
Allow to cook for about 10 minutes or until the bottom is lightly browned.
Carefully flip the crepe over cool on the other side.
Fold the crepe in half and then in half again.
Remove to a serving dish. Top with powdered sugar and your favorite jam. Serve immediately.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Vanilla Crepes
recipes.description: French-style pancakes so versatile they can be dressed up with any of your favorite fillings.

instructions.text: Sift the flour, sugar and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and vanilla and beat until smooth.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Using a spatula, loosen the crepe, turn and cook on the other side. This side will cook much quicker, around 30 seconds.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve filled with sweetened ricotta.

recipes.title: Strawberry Crepes
recipes.description: Crepes filled with syrupy strawberries and whipped cream.

instructions.text: For the crepes: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Using a spatula, loosen the crepe, turn and cook on the other side. This side will cook much quicker, around 30 seconds.
For the filling: Add the sugar, strawberries and butter to another non-stick pan on medium heat. Stir until the sugar and butter thicken, then add the strawberry syrup and mix well.
To assemble: Add the strawberry mixture to each crepe and roll up. Top with a dollop of the whipped cream and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: For a quick crepe filling use canned cherry or apple pie filling.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Using a spatula, loosen the crepe, turn and cook on the other side. This side will cook much quicker, around 30 seconds.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

recipes.title: Chocolate Hazelnut Crepes

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

recipes.title: Vegan Crepes
recipes.description: Delicate, light crepes that are suitable for dairy-free, egg-free and vegan diets.

instructions.text: Sift the flour, sugar and salt into a large mixing bowl. Set aside.
In another bowl combine the soymilk, coconut milk, water and soy margarine.
Gradually add to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.

Heat up a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and lightly grease with soy margarine. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 1 minute. Using a spatula, loosen the crepe, turn and cook on the other side.

recipes.title: Chocolate Crepes
recipes.description: These chocolate crepes make a great base for any dessert filling.

Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

recipes.title: Western Omelet
recipes.description: A favorite omelet. Cut in two to create sandwiches, if desired.

ingredients.prep_note: use an onion if scallions not available

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a skillet.
Whisk together the eggs with all of the other ingredients.
Pour egg mix into skillet.
Cook one side, flip, and cook the other.
Don't overcook the omelet.

recipes.title: Asparagus Omelet
recipes.description: A delicious way to get a veggie in at breakfast time.

instructions.text: Cook asparagus until they are tender.
Whisk the eggs with salt, pepper, and milk.
For each omelet, butter a skillet and add half a cup of egg mix.
Don't scramble, just lift the edges occasionally and move the mixture around in the skillet.
Add 1/4 cup of cheese and 4 asparagus spears to one side of the omelet.
Flip the other half of the omelet over the asparagus.
Cook until done and season with salt and pepper.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Vegetable Omelet
recipes.description: A deliciously healthy omelet - a great way to sneak some veggies to the kids.

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the vegetables, salt and pepper and cook until done.
Add the tomatoes.
Beat the eggs, and milk in a bowl.
Using another skillet, add the butter and pour in the eggs.
Cook until eggs are still soft but set. Add the vegetables and fold the omelet.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Eggs Florentine
recipes.description: This is as elegant as Eggs Benedict, but you can feel self-righteous and smug 'cause you're using spinach.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Use a skillet to melt the butter. Mix in the flour, salt and pepper and blend with a wooden spoon or whisk.
Lower the heat and mix in the milk. Stir continuously as the mixture gets thick.
Lightly butter a muffin pan. Add 2 teaspoons of water to each muffin cup.
Crack the eggs and slide one into each cup.
Bake the eggs for 15 minutes.
While eggs are baking, heat the spinach in a microwave and drain the liquid.
Butter a 9 x 13 baking dish. Transfer the spinach to the baking dish. Divide the eggs over the spinach. Spread the sauce and the parmesan cheese over the eggs.
Bake eggs for 5 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and just turning brown.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast in a Skillet
recipes.description: A breakfast indulgence. You can substitute ham for the bacon, if you want to.

instructions.text: Fry the bacon in a skillet and drain.
Use the drippings in the skillet to cook the onion and potatoes for approximately 5 minutes.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl and add to the skillet. Stir until eggs are cooked.
Season with salt and pepper.
Top the eggs with the bacon pieces and the cheese. Let the cheese melt.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Egg Croquettes
recipes.description: Feeling a little French? Oh la la, try these delicious eggs.

instructions.text: Mix the chopped boiled eggs with the parsley.
Use a skillet to heat the butter and sauté the onions until they are softened.
Add the flour and milk to the skillet. Keep stirring until the mixture thickens.
Mix in the Cheddar cheese and salt and pepper. Add the chopped boiled eggs.
Refrigerate for 3 hours.
Use your hands to form eggs in cylindrical patties. Roll patties in the bread crumbs to coat.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet and cook patties until they turn brown, around 2 minutes.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Mexican Eggs
recipes.description: Try these when you're in the mood for something a little different.

instructions.text: Beat the eggs. Add the beans and cheese.
Scramble the eggs until done.
Top the eggs with the salsa.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Croque Madame
recipes.description: This is another treat from France. They really know their food.

instructions.text: Use half of the butter to spread on each slice of bread.
Pile a slice of ham and cheese on top of the bread and create sandwiches using the remaining bread slices.
Fry the sandwiches in a skillet. The cheese should be melted and the bread should be browned.
Prepare the eggs: Place enough water in a pan to cover the eggs and add a tsp of olive oil.
Boil the water, then lower the temperature to a simmer.
Crack the eggs and slide carefully into the water.
Turn off the stove and let the eggs sit until poached – 3 to 4 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to remove the poached eggs to a plate.
Melt the remaining half of the butter and add the parsley.
Transfer one sandwich each to 4 serving plates. Top the sandwich with one poached egg.
Lightly pour the butter mix over the sandwiches. Serve while hot.

recipes.title: Eggs and Spinach
recipes.description: Serve this when you have company for brunch.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Use a skillet to heat the oil and sauté the garlic.
Mix in the tomatoes, salt and pepper. Let tomatoes warm, about 4 minutes.
Add spinach leaves and continue to cook for another minute.
Place mixture in a 9 x 13 baking dish.
Whip eggs white until they are fluffy. Spread over spinach.
Use a spoon to transfer the egg yolks onto the spinach.
Bake for 20 minutes.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Huevos Rancheros
recipes.description: Spice up your breakfast with this great south-of-border dish.

Place the tortillas on a platter.
Melt the butter in a skillet.
Beat the eggs, salt and milk in a bowl. Cook in the skillet.
Transfer two warm tortillas on each plate and divide the scrambled eggs between them.

notes: Serve with the following: Chopped scallions and/or tomatoes, Finely grated cheese, Chopped peppers, Salsa, Guacamole

recipes.title: Texas Eggs
recipes.description: This is perfect for those who love it hot!

instructions.text: Heat up the salsa in a skillet.
Crack the eggs on top of the salsa. Season to taste.
Transfer the salsa and eggs to individual dinner plates.
Serve with the tortilla chips, sour cream, avocado, and cilantro.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Baked Eggs

Mix the herbs and garlic in a bowl.
Whip together the butter and cream in another bowl.
Prepare a baking sheet with 6 ramekins.
Add the butter mix to the ramekins.
Bake for 2 minutes.
Take baking sheet with ramekins out of oven.
Crack the eggs and carefully slide one into each ramekin.
Add the herbs and the ricotta on top of the eggs.
Season with the salt and pepper.
Bake the eggs for 5 minutes.
Serve the baked eggs immediately.

recipes.title: Polenta and Eggs
recipes.description: Polenta is so creamy, and the eggs just add to the flavor.

instructions.text: Place the dried tomatoes in some boiling water and let soak.
Heat up the milk and broth in a saucepan. Add the cornmeal and keep whisking.
Have heat on medium and stir several times for about 15 minutes.
Add the Parmesan and blend. Let sit over low heat.
Remove the dried tomatoes from the water and drain them.
Heat the oil in a skillet. Toss in dried tomatoes and onions. Cook until onions are softened, then take off stove.
Use a deep pan and fill it halfway with water. Squeeze in the juice of the lemon.
When water is simmering, crack the eggs and transfer them carefully into the pan. Let the eggs simmer for 4 minutes, then removed and drain on a paper towel.
Transfer the polenta into individual serving dishes. Top each dish with 2 eggs.

recipes.title: Kale and Swiss Cheese Omelette
recipes.description: This omelette is the perfect weekend breakfast indulgence.

Whisk the eggs together with the milk and season with salt and pepper.
Add the eggs to the pan and cook until just starting to set, then sprinkle with the kale mixture and top with the cheese.
Cook until egg is set and cheese is melted, then flip half the omelette over and cook for a further minute to set.

recipes.title: Johnnycakes

Butter a skillet and a tablespoon to drop the batter.
Fry the johnnycakes until browned on both sides.
Serve with applesauce or butter.

recipes.title: Apple Pancakes
recipes.description: These taste incredible and are fun to watch as they deflate.

ingredients.item: Granny Smith apples, peeled and cut into small thin slices

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Mix together the cinnamon and sugar.
In another bowl, whip the eggs, flour, milk, salt, and vanilla until the mixture is smooth.
Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the apples and the cinnamon sugar. Stir and cook for 5 minutes.
Place the batter in a baking dish. Pour the apples on top on the batter.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Flip the pancake upside down on a plate. Once the pancake deflates (it will) cut and serve.

recipes.title: Almond Pancakes
recipes.description: These pancakes are absolutely delicious. Serve with butter or syrup.

instructions.text: Mix together the flours, oats, baking soda and salt.
Use a second bowl to stir together the eggs and buttermilk.
Mix the egg/milk mixture into the flour and stir until all ingredients are well-blended.
Grease a skillet and add a quarter cup of batter. Top the batter with some almonds.
Cook the pancake until browned on one side, then flip.
Repeat with the rest of the batter.

recipes.title: Belgian Waffles
recipes.description: Try these light and fluffy Belgian waffles when you have company. They'll never leave.

ingredients.item: large eggs, divided into whites and yolks

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
Sift the flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl.
In another bowl, beat the yolks and sugar until well-blended. Mix in the vanilla, butter, and milk and use a whisk to mix.
Add the egg mix to the flour mix. Blend well.
Whip the egg whites with a hand mixer. Fold the egg whites into the batter.
Spray the waffle iron with the vegetable spray.
Transfer some of the batter to the waffle iron.
Cook until waffles are nice and brown.

recipes.title: Chocolate Waffle
recipes.description: Waffles are a Sunday treat that everyone loves.

instructions.text: Preheat a waffle iron.
Mix together the flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt.
Use another bowl to beat the eggs, vanilla, and butter. Add the buttermilk and mix.
Mix in the chocolate chips and combine.
Let batter sit for 10 minutes.
Spray the waffle iron with vegetable spray.
Transfer batter to waffle iron.
Cook until waffles are golden brown on each side.
Repeat with all of the batter. Keep the waffles warm.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Quiche
recipes.description: Quiches are tasty and easy to make.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Mix together the eggs, ham, half-and-half, nutmeg, and cheese. Season to taste.
Transfer the eggs to the pre-made crust.
Bake for 35 minutes.

notes: When it's blended in the quiche, creamy and warm, it is just out of this world.
This would go perfectly with steamed broccoli or a vegetable medley.
Serve with a garden salad or some corn fritters.
I like to use parmesan cheese with the spinach and some other seasonings, but you could choose other milder cheeses as well.
Combine quiche and Mexican casserole in one for a family surprise.

I love serving this bacon and cheese quiche for breakfast. It is much easier for me to mix all the ingredients in one bowl and leave it to cook for an hour than making 4 or 6 plates filled with bacon and eggs. Your family will love it, I promise.
Make sure you use fresh herbs if you can, they just add a little extra flavor to the quiche everyone likes.
Slice and serve with your favorite side dishes.
It may not be the best quiche to make if you are hosting your first romantic date because you might have onion breath! But I guarantee it's totally worth it otherwise.
If you can't afford crab or prefer the imitation crab, then go for it.
Make sure you use cooked chicken as the time the quiche will stay in the oven with the other ingredients is not quite enough to fully cook chicken.
A Caesar salad is awesome with this quiche.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Filled Crepes
recipes.description: Crepes are lighter than pancakes and so delicious. You can experiment with the filling.

instructions.text: Mix together the milk, flour, baking powder and chill overnight.
Melt half of the butter in a crepe pan. Add 1/4 cup of the batter.
Turn and rotate the crepe pan. Cook until one side is a golden brown, then flip and cook the other side.
Repeat until batter is used up.
Melt the remaining butter and saute the mushrooms and the onions. Mix in the ham, and add the flour and the milk to thicken the filling.
Divide the filling between the crepes. Roll the crepe closed.

recipes.title: Cheese Souffle
recipes.description: Souffles taste divine and they make an impressive presentation.

ingredients.item: eggs, divided into whites and yolks

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Butter a 2-qrt souffle dish. Dust the bottom of the dish with the Parmesan cheese.
Use a saucepan to melt the butter. Add both flours. Mix vigorously.
While continuing to whisk, add the cream and water. Add the remaining Parmesan, the cheddar, and the salt and pepper.
Stir until mixture boils.
Take the saucepan off the stove and add the yolks. Whisk until integrated.
Pour the mixture in a bowl and let sit.
Beat the egg whites with a hand mixer for 5 minutes.
Fold the egg whites into the egg mixture.
Transfer the soufflé into the soufflé dish.
Bake for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Soufflé
recipes.description: The right ingredients make this a wonderful soufflé.

ingredients.item: eggs, divided into whites and yolks

instructions.text: Melt 2 tablespoon butter in a saucepan. Mix in the shallots and stir for 2 minutes.
Stir in the flour. Add the milk. Keep whisking until smooth.
Let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes. It should be thick by then.
Add the cheddar, salt and pepper, and egg yolks.
Keep stirring for 4 minutes.
Pour the mixture into a bowl and stir in the chives and ham.
Cover with plastic and refrigerate for half an hour.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Butter a soufflé dish.
Beat the eggs whites with a hand mixer until they are stiff.
Fold the whites into the cheese mix.
Pour the batter into the soufflé dish.
Bake for 40 minutes.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Crab Soufflé
recipes.description: An elegant soufflé that can either be served alone as a first course or paired with a simple salad for a main meal.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease four ramekins with the butter and set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt pepper, parsley and paprika till well combined.
Gently stir in the crab and cream cheese, taking care not to break up the crab too much.
Pour the mixture into the prepared ramekins and bake until the tops are golden brown, about 40 minutes.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with a side salad and crusty bread for a full meal.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: French Toast Soufflé
recipes.description: A delicious, different take on French toast with a crunchy top and soft gooey middle. This is sure to become a breakfast favorite.

instructions.text: Grease a 7x11 baking dish and fill with the bread cubes. This should take up half the dish.
Mix together the maple syrup, butter and cream cheese until well combined.
Spoon this mixture evenly over the bread.
Beat together the eggs, half and half, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla and pour this mixture over the bread, making sure that all the bread is covered.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight.
The next morning, remove from the fridge and let stand for at least 20 minutes before baking. In the meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bake for an hour or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with fruit and drizzle with maple syrup.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Enchiladas
recipes.description: These scrumptious enchiladas are perfect for breakfast.

instructions.text: Melt the butter, then add the flour.
Stir until mixture is smooth.
Add the milk, keep whisking until the mixture is thickened.
Place pan on the counter and stir in all of the other ingredients.

notes: This appears to be a sauce recipe for breakfast enchiladas - additional tortillas and filling ingredients needed.

flags: Appears to be partial recipe - sauce only

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Sausage Twist
recipes.description: This twist can be cut into individual pieces for a yummy breakfast.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Flatten out the dough on a baking sheet.
Top the dough with the sausage, olives and cheeses.
Fold the dough over the filling and make diagonal cuts on top.
Beat the egg and brush over the dough.
Bake for 20 minutes. Dough should be a light brown.
Slice the dough into six portions.

recipes.title: Stuffed French Toast
recipes.description: French toast with a filling – yummy.

instructions.text: Blend the eggs, milk, and honey in a bowl.
Place half of the bread on the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
Top with the cream cheese, and the remaining bread.
Top the bread with the egg mixture, making sure to coat all, and chill overnight.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.
Top with butter or syrup.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Frittata
recipes.description: Fix this when you have a hungry crowd.

instructions.text: Fry the bacon in a skillet. When bacon is crispy, mix in the green pepper.
Stir for approximately 3 minutes.
Remove skillet from stove and drain any excess fat. Add the salt and pepper.
Place skillet back on stove and mix in the diced potatoes. Stir for approximately 2 minutes.
Add the eggs. Stir for 5 minutes. Eggs should still be soft.
Top frittata with the feta cheese.
Preheat the broiler.
Broil frittatas for 5 minutes.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Enchiladas
recipes.description: There's no reason not to enjoy a delicious enchilada for breakfast.

instructions.text: Crumble and fry the sausage in a skillet. Drain on a paper towel.
Use another skillet to melt the butter.
Add the scallions, eggs, salt and pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Place the mixture in a bowl and mix in the sausage and 1 cup of cheese sauce (see recipe below).
Divide the mix onto each tortilla.
Roll up the tortilla and transfer them to a buttered 9 x 13 baking dish.
Top with the rest of the cheese sauce and the Monterey Jack.
Bake for half an hour at 350 degrees.
Serve with toppings.
For Cheese Sauce: Use a saucepan to melt the butter. Beat in the flour and keep whisking for a minute. Add the milk and cook over low heat for 5 minutes while continuously stirring.
Mix in the cheese and salt and stir until cheese in melted.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Sausage and Cheese Breakfast Pizza
recipes.description: Pizza for breakfast - a great way to start the day!

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Brown the sausage over medium heat and drain.

Press the dough together into a greased 12-inch pizza pan to make one round crust. Spread the cooked sausage and bell pepper over the dough and then top evenly with the hash browns. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese.
Beat together the milk, eggs, salt and pepper until well combined and pour this over the top of the cheddar cheese.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Bake until the crust is browned and cheese is melted, about 25 minutes.

notes: Serving suggestion: For a healthier option, use ground turkey instead of sausage.

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Muffins
recipes.description: Delicious and easy to prepare, these are great for breakfast or even lunch on the go.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Mix in the cheese. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the ham. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serving suggestion: The ham can be replaced with crumbled bacon.

recipes.title: Hash Brown Casserole
recipes.description: This casserole is super easy to prepare, great if you're having a crowd over.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a 9x9-inch oven-proof dish with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients, reserving half of the cheddar cheese.
Pour the mixture into the prepared dish and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes.

notes: Serving suggestion: Top with crushed cornflakes before baking for a lovely, crisp crust.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Apple Breakfast Bars
recipes.description: Make these nutritious bars ahead of time and store in the fridge for a quick breakfast.

ingredients.item: granny smith apples, peeled and grated

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 8x8-inch baking dish.
Squeeze the grated apple to remove excess moisture. Add all the ingredients to a large bowl and mix until well combined.
Press the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Bake until lightly browned, about 30 minutes.
Cut into bars while still warm.

notes: Serving suggestion: Tastes great crushed over yoghurt.

missing_inputs: 1 1/2 cups granny smith apples, peeled and grated
assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Tacos
recipes.description: These delicious tacos make a hearty breakfast.

instructions.text: Crumble the sausage into a nonstick pan and cook over medium heat until browned. Set aside.

Whisk the eggs, milk, salt and pepper together. Add the eggs to a lightly greased pan over medium heat. Stir and cook until the eggs are almost firm and then add in the sausage. Continue cooking until eggs are firm.
Heat the tortillas on a griddle. Sprinkle with cheese and spoon in some of the egg and sausage mix. Add salsa and cilantro to your taste.

notes: Serving suggestion: Bacon can be used instead of chorizo.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Parfait
recipes.description: These delicious parfaits can be made ahead and refrigerated for a quick breakfast.

instructions.text: Mix the frozen berries together with the apple juice and vanilla extract. Set aside until the berries are thawed.

Spoon 2 tablespoons of the muesli into four small dishes or glasses. Top each layer of muesli with 2 tablespoons of yoghurt and two tablespoons of the berries. Repeat the layers until all the mix is used up.
Cover and refrigerate until needed.

notes: Serving suggestion: Any of your favorite fruit can be used instead of the frozen berries.

recipes.title: Breakfast Quinoa
recipes.description: Try this breakfast quinoa, packed with fiber and protein, as a great alternative to your morning oatmeal.

instructions.text: Rinse the quinoa until the water runs clear. Strain well.
Heat the milk over medium heat until just warm. Add the quinoa and salt and mix well.
Lower the heat and stir in the cinnamon.
Keep cooking until all the liquid is absorbed by the quinoa, about 20 minutes.
Turn off the heat and mix in the maple syrup.
Fold in the berries, coconut and sunflower seeds and cover and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

notes: Serving suggestion: More milk can be added for a thinner consistency.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Calzone
recipes.description: A hearty breakfast that can be made ahead and frozen for the week.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Beat 8 eggs with the milk, salt and pepper. Set aside.
In a pan over medium heat cook the sausage until browned. Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.

Turn heat down to low and cook the eggs, stirring until set. Add the eggs to a bowl together with the pork sausage. Mix them together and allow to cool slightly for about 10 minutes. Then stir in the cheese.

Roll out the dough and divide into 6 rectangles. Divide the egg and sausage mix between them. Fold the dough over and seal the edges with egg wash. Press the tines of a fork all around the edges to seal.
Place calzones on a greased cookie sheet. Brush the remaining egg over the tops and poke once with a fork to create four holes.
Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes.

notes: Serving suggestion: If preferred, bacon or ham can be used instead of the sausage.

recipes.title: Breakfast Panini Sandwich
recipes.description: A great breakfast sandwich that can easily be adapted to suit your taste.

instructions.text: Heat the butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Beat the eggs, salt, pepper and chives together and add to the pan. Stir and cook until set.
Cut the ciabatta rolls in half lengthways and divide the eggs among them. Layer with the ham, tomato and cheese.
Cook on a preheated panini maker or grill until the cheese is melted and the bread is browned.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Try using Brie instead of Cheddar cheese for an interesting twist.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Blueberry Breakfast Crescents
recipes.description: Great for breakfast or dessert, these blueberry crescents are so quick to throw together yet so delicious.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Unroll the crescent roll dough and place the triangles on a baking sheet.
Mix the cream cheese and sugar together till well combined. Fold in the blueberries. Divide the mixture among the crescent rolls. Roll up the dough and seal the edges and ends.
Bake until golden brown, about 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool.

notes: Serving suggestion: For an added zip try adding some lemon zest to your cream cheese mixture.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Breakfast Bruschetta
recipes.description: A delicious way to jazz up plain, old scrambled eggs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Slice the baguette into half-inch thick slices. Place on a baking tray that has been sprayed with nonstick spray.
Brush the slices with the melted butter and sprinkle with the garlic powder.
Bake until crispy, about 5 to six minutes.
In a large bowl mix together the tomato, olive oil and basil. Set aside.
Heat the butter in a pan over medium heat.
Beat the eggs, salt, pepper and chives together and add to the pan. Stir and cook until set. Add the eggs to the tomato mixture and combine well.
Distribute the egg mix among the toasted bread slices and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Try adding your favorite cheese to your scrambled eggs.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Spinach Cheese Wraps
recipes.description: These wraps are so quick and easy to prepare. Enjoy them for breakfast or even as a quick weeknight dinner.

instructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft. Add in the spinach and cook until just starting to wilt. Remove from heat.
Divide the mix between 2 tortillas, then top with the cheese and remaining two tortillas. Season and roll up the tortillas.
Cook in a preheated sandwich press until the cheese is melted and tortilla is golden.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with scrambled eggs for a hearty breakfast.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Au Gratin Potato Muffins
recipes.description: Replace your breakfast hash browns with these cheesy potato muffins that are made from a few simple, everyday ingredients.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a muffin tin (8 cups) with a nonstick cooking spray. Add a layer of potato slices to each muffin cup. Top with a layer of cheese and then scallions. Repeat until all ingredients are used up.
Season with the salt and pepper. Add two tablespoons of the cream to each muffin cup. Cover with foil.
Bake for 40 minutes, removing the foil halfway through the cooking time.
Remove from the oven and allow to sit for 4 to 5 minutes before inverting onto a plate.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: If desired, add half a cup of cooked chopped ham to your muffins.

recipes.title: Pancake and Fruit Kabobs
recipes.description: Kids will love these mini pancake and fruit skewers that are so fun to eat.

instructions.text: Sift together the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder in a large bowl. Set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the egg, butter, milk and vanilla. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well until smooth.
Heat an oiled griddle over medium high heat. Drop tablespoons full of the batter on the heated griddle. Cook until bubbles appear and most have burst, then flip over and cook the other side.
To assemble, thread a pancake onto a skewer. Alternate with strawberries, pancakes and bananas.
Drizzle with the maple syrup and serve.

notes: Serving suggestion: For a savory kabob use your favorite breakfast sausage instead of the fruit.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Bacon and Egg Cups
recipes.description: An easy all-in-one breakfast recipe; great for when you are cooking for a large group.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Fry the bacon slices for 2 to 3 minutes to par cook them. Drain on paper towels.
Line the cups of a muffin pan with the bacon slices, creating a ring around the side of each cup. Drop a teaspoon of the melted butter into each cup.
Crack one egg into each cup.
Season with the salt and pepper and sprinkle with the cheese.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the egg reaches the doneness you prefer.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Sprinkle with chopped scallions and serve with toast points.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: French Toast Casserole
recipes.description: Prepare this delicious treat the night before and simply pop in the oven for a no fuss breakfast.

instructions.text: Grease a 7x11-inch baking dish and fill the bottom with the bread cubes.
Mix together the maple syrup, butter and cream cheese until well combined.
Spoon this mixture evenly over the bread.
Beat together the eggs, half and half, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla and pour this mixture over the bread, making sure that all the bread is covered.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight.
The next morning, remove from the fridge and let stand for at least 20 minutes before baking. In the meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bake for an hour or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve warm, drizzled with maple syrup.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Cheesy Scrambled Eggs with Herbs

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until well blended.

Place about 1 tablespoon unsalted butter in a frying pan and melt over medium-high heat. Swirl to coat base and sides of pan. Adjust heat to medium-low and pour egg mixture into buttered pan. Gently stir with a fork to create a curdled, fluffy mixture and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until eggs are slightly set and cheese is just melted.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Omit cheese and other types of herbs of your choice.

recipes.title: Egg in a Hole

instructions.text: Using a cookie or biscuit cutter, cut a hole in the middle of bread slice.

Pour 1 teaspoon oil in a pan and set over medium heat. Place bread on pan. Crack an egg in the middle of the hole. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until bread is golden brown. Turn bread over and cook the other side until egg is set. Transfer onto plates and top with grated cheese. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: You can use finely chopped herbs in place of cheese. You may also use other types of bread.

recipes.title: Filipino-Style Omelet

instructions.text: Beat eggs and salt until light. Set aside.

Sauté garlic in 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat until brown and fragrant. Add onions and stir-fry until wilted, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and daing flakes. Continue cooking until tomatoes are soft, about 3 minutes. Remove filling from oil with a slotted spoon and transfer to a plate or bowl and set aside.

Using the same oil where vegetables were cooked, pour all of the beaten eggs and swirl pan until bottom is evenly coated. Cook for two minutes or until set. Spoon filling over eggs and spread evenly. Fold one side over the other, being careful not to spill the filling. Cook for another minute, then transfer to a plate. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: If dried fish or "daing" is not available in your area, use canned tuna in brine. Make sure to drain tuna before using.

instructions.text: Beat together eggs, salt and pepper until light and well-combined. Stir in mayonnaise and blend well.

Pour about 1 tablespoon canola oil in a pan and place over medium heat. Once you see a hint of smoke inside the pan, gradually pour in egg mixture. If you are using a large pan, you can pour all of the mixture at once. If your pan is small, pour only half of the egg mixture.

Swirl pan to allow remaining liquid to spread further, cutting into the coagulated portions, if necessary. Once eggs are set, fold half of egg over the other, retaining a slightly moist interior. Remove from heat and transfer to a plate. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs Italiana on Toast

instructions.text: Beat eggs with pesto sauce, salt and pepper until frothy. Set aside.

Heat oil over medium heat and add beaten eggs. Cook while stirring with a fork or rubber spatula until curd-like in consistency. Remove from heat and divide among toasted baguettes. Serve immediately as open-faced sandwiches.

For Pesto: Combine basil leaves, walnuts, garlic and Parmesan cheese in a food processor and pulse until creamy. Slowly add olive oil in a thin stream while pulsing. Turn off food processor and season with salt and pepper to taste.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace pesto with Cajun seasoning for a hot and spicy version.

recipes.title: Sweet Ham Omelet

instructions.text: Sauté green onions in butter in a heavy pan until soft.

Whisk together eggs and milk and pour over sautéed onions. Cook until bottom part of egg sets. Lift egg to allow excess to run underneath. Continue cooking until nearly set. Spread cooked ham cubes on top of egg. Sprinkle with cheese and season to taste. Remove from heat and loosely cover pan until cheese melts.
Transfer to a large platter and cut into wedges. Serve warm.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace sweet ham with sausage or other cold cuts you prefer. Add red pepper flakes for a spicy punch.

missing_inputs: 1 cup sweet ham, cooked and cubed

recipes.title: Overnight Egg and Sausage Bake
recipes.description: This delicious casserole can be prepared the night before and just popped in the oven for breakfast, perfect for a lazy weekend morning.

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Sauté the onion for 2 to 3 minutes then add in the sausage.
Crumble the sausage and cook until browned. Drain and set aside.
Beat the eggs, milk, pepper, garlic powder, salt and mustard together. Stir in the sausage mixture and the cheese. Gently stir in the bread cubes.
Pour the mixture into a greased 11x7-inch baking dish.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes prior to baking.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F for 45 minutes.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with buttered toast points.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Bacon and Egg Cupcakes
recipes.description: A full, hearty breakfast all rolled together in an easy cupcake.

ingredients.item: slices of thick cut bacon, chopped

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
In a pan, fry the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels.
In a large bowl mix together the bacon, cheese, grated potato and scallions.
Divide the mixture evenly among the muffin cups. Layer with a slice of tomato and then crack an egg into each cup.
Season with the salt and pepper.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the egg reaches the doneness you prefer.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Refrigerate leftovers and reheat in the microwave before serving.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Egg and Cheese Frittata
recipes.description: A quick and easy breakfast frittata recipe that can easily be adapted to your taste.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper, garlic powder and scallions and pour into the skillet.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Add crumbled bacon or ham to your egg mixture for an all-in-one breakfast.

recipes.title: Cheesy Eggs and Spinach Skillet Bake
recipes.description: An easy frittata recipe that can be served for breakfast or paired with a salad for lunch or dinner.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper and garlic powder and pour into the skillet. Layer the spinach over the egg mixture.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Feta cheese pairs really well with spinach, try using it instead of cheddar in this recipe.

recipes.title: Apple Pie French Toast

instructions.text: Cook apples in water until tender, about 10 minutes.

Combine 1/4 cup of sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg and add to apples. Cook, with frequent stirring, until thickened, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add lemon juice. Stir until well-blended.
Divide apple filling into 4 portions and spread evenly on four of the bread slices. Top with remaining bread and press down slightly to seal.
Whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla and remaining sugar.

Dip sandwiches in beaten mixture until coated. Cook over medium heat on a buttered skillet until both sides are golden. Place on individual plates and dust with confectioner's sugar. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve sandwiches with whipped cream and orange juice. Replace apples with peaches or pears.

recipes.title: Basic Flapjacks

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
Whisk together milk, eggs, butter, and vanilla extract. Gradually add sifted ingredients to milk mixture and whisk until just combined.

Brush a non-stick pan with vegetable oil or melted butter and place over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup batter into pan and cook cake until bubbles appear on the surface and underside is slightly browned. Turn flapjack over to cook the other side. Transfer to a heat proof plate and keep warm in a low-heat oven. Repeat with remaining batter.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve flapjacks with your choice of syrup and fruits.

recipes.title: Buttermilk Breakfast Waffles

instructions.text: Pre-heat waffle maker as per manufacturer's directions and brush with canola oil or unsalted butter.
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl until well blended.

Whisk together buttermilk, sour cream, melted butter and egg yolks in another bowl until combined. Gradually add dry ingredients and mix until moist but not thin. To make sure you did not over mix batter, there should still be lumps.
In another bowl, beat egg whites over high heat until still but not dry. Gently fold into batter until no white streaks are visible.
Spoon batter into preheated waffle maker. The amount of batter depends on the size of your waffle maker, however leave about an inch border on all sides, spreading the batter if needed.
Close the lid and cook until waffles for about 3 to 5 minutes, or until steam stops. Remove waffles and place in a heat-proof plate and into a warm oven. Repeat with remaining batter.

notes: Serving suggestion: You can replace buttermilk with whole milk or cream. Top with your choice of syrup or fruit.

recipes.title: Creamy Cheesy French Toasts

instructions.text: Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread. Place a slice of cheese on one piece of bread over the buttered side. Top with another piece of bread, buttered side-down and press slightly to seal sandwich. Repeat with remaining bread and cheese. Set aside.
Beat egg until light in color and combine with milk, sugar and vanilla. Stir until well blended.
Melt about 1 tablespoon butter in a pan over medium low heat. Swirl to coat bottom of pan evenly.

Dip a sandwich in the egg-milk mixture until some of the liquid is absorbed. Place sandwich on buttered pan. Cook until golden-brown, about 2 to 3 minutes. Turn sandwich over and continue cooking until the other side is done, about 2 minutes. Repeat with remaining sandwiches, adding butter as needed to prevent toasts from sticking onto the pan.
Drain on paper towels, if needed and cut each sandwich in half diagonally to make 12 sandwiches. Serve hot or warm.

notes: Serving suggestion: You can replace milk with light cream and add bacon or ham slices with cheese as filling.

missing_inputs: 12 pieces sliced white bread, crusts trimmed

recipes.title: Traditional Hotcakes

instructions.text: Place water in a kettle and allow to boil. When water is on a full rolling boil, remove from heat and measure one cupful.
Combine cornmeal and salt in a bowl. Gradually add boiling water to cornmeal and stir until you get a thick, pasty mash.
Pour about 4 tablespoons bacon grease or melted butter into a heavy skillet and place over medium heat.
Shape about 1/4 cup of mash into a patty fry one side until brown and crispy. Flip cake to cook the other side. Repeat with remaining mixture.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with maple syrup or molasses for breakfast or snacks, or as side dish to mess o' greens.

recipes.title: Apple-Bacon-Cheese Muffin Sandwiches

instructions.text: Pre-heat oven to 350°F.

Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet. Spread about 1/2 tablespoon cheese sauce on each of the bread slices. Top with bacon, apple slices and cheese. Bake until cheese melts, about 5 to 7 minutes. Serve right away.

notes: Serving suggestion: You can use a firmer type of bread like ciabatta and use orange segments instead of apples. Substitute cheese sauce with cream cheese or fruit jam.

recipes.title: Basic Hash Browns

instructions.text: Combine grated potatoes, onion, salt and pepper. Mix well.

Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a pan set over medium heat. Form about 1/4 cup potato mixture into an oblong shaped patty and fry until golden, about 5 minutes. Turn patty over and cook until done, about 3 minutes. Repeat with remaining grated potatoes.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with savory meat cuts or stir-fried vegetables.

recipes.title: Breakfast Churros

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder in a large bowl. Set aside.

In a medium-sized pan, combine water, canola oil, salt and sugar. Place over medium heat and allow to boil. Remove from heat and gradually add to dry ingredients, stirring as you go. Batter should be sticky and smooth, almost like a dough. Spoon into a pastry bag and set aside.

Pour enough vegetable in a deep pan to fry churros. Oil should be about 2 inches deep. When oil is about 350°F, carefully squeeze churros dough into hot oil, creating an elongated shape. Deep-fry until golden brown. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Keep warm in an oven. Repeat with remaining dough.
Cut pastries into desired lengths and sprinkle with granulated sugar or drizzle with honey.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with black coffee or hot chocolate. You can pair this with the "Mexican Breakfast Choco Drink" recipe.

missing_inputs: to sprinkle additional granulated sugar or honey

recipes.title: Breakfast Oat Brulée

ingredients.item: unsalted pistachio nuts, toasted and chopped

instructions.text: Preheat grill to 400°F.

Boil water and salt over medium heat in a deep pan or pot. Gradually add oats while stirring to prevent lumps. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking, about 3 to 5 minutes until oats are soft and mixture is thickened. Stir in cream, cinnamon, 2 tablespoons brown sugar and nuts.
Remove from heat and spoon oat mixture into 8 ramekins. Arrange banana slices over oat mixture. Top each ramekin with 1/4 cup yogurt and sprinkle with remaining sugar.
Arrange ramekins on a cookie sheet and place under the pre-heated grill for 1 to 2 minutes or until sugar caramelizes. Serve hot or warm.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with fresh fruit as breakfast. You may replace yogurt with whipped cream. Mango can be used a substitute for bananas.

recipes.title: Breakfast Sandwich with Summer Fruits

ingredients.item: confectioner's sugar, mixed with 1/4 tsp cinnamon

instructions.text: Slice ciabatta lengthwise and toast until crisp.

Spread cream cheese on bottom portions of bread and top with mashed mango pulp. Arrange cherries over mango and dust with sugar-cinnamon mix. Cover with top portion and dust with more sugar-cinnamon mix. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: You may use other summer fruit or berries in season. Grilled fruit like pineapples and peaches are also good substitutes.

recipes.title: Cheesy Mushroom and Egg Sandwiches

ingredients.item: button mushrooms, wiped and cut in half
large eggs, hard boiled and coarsely chopped

instructions.text: Heat oil in and pan and sauté spring onions and mushrooms over high heat until tender and golden, about 4 to 5 minutes. Adjust heat to medium and stir in cheese sauce. Heat until very hot. Remove from heat and stir in chopped eggs. Divide filling into two portions and sandwich between two slices of toasted wheat bread. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace egg with chopped spiced ham and add 1 tablespoon chopped jalapeños to filling mix to add zing.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Porridge

instructions.text: Cook oats and milk over medium-low heat until thick, about 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Divide into 2 bowls and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Drizzle with honey. Sprinkle with cinnamon, if desired. Serve hot.

notes: Serving suggestion: Top porridge with slices of fruit. Serve with orange juice.

recipes.title: Creamy Banana Cereal

instructions.text: Toss banana slices with lemon juice.
Beat together yogurt and cream cheese. Add banana slices and mix well.
Beat egg whites until stiff and gently fold into banana-cream mixture. Spoon mixture into individual glasses or bowls and top with cereal or muesli. Serve immediately or chill before serving.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace bananas with other types of fruit in season. Yogurt can be replaced with cream. Add sugar or honey to taste.

recipes.title: English Crumpets

instructions.text: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Set aside.
Whisk together eggs, milk, butter and vanilla in a medium-sized bowl. Gradually add to dry ingredients, whisking until just combined. Do not over mix.
Brush 2 to 3 biscuit ramekins with butter or oil.

Brush a non-stick pan with butter or vegetable oil. Place over low heat. Once pan starts to smoke, place ramekins into pan and spoon batter into ramekin. Do not let batter overflow. Number of ramekins would depend on the size of your pan.

Cook crumpets until bubbly on top. Remove ramekins and turn cakes over. You may also want to leave crumpets as they are, browning the base thoroughly while tops remain light in color and riddled with holes.

Remove from heat and keep warm on a plate in a low-heat oven. Repeat with remaining batter, brushing cooking pan and ramekins with more butter or oil as needed. Serve warm with butter and jam or eggs.

notes: Serving suggestion: Spread one crumpet with butter then top with jam and fruit slices. Cover with another cake to make a sandwich.

recipes.title: Fruity Breakfast Sandwich

instructions.text: Spread pineapple marmalade on one side of each bread slice. Place one slice on a plate, marmalade-side up. Top with remaining pieces. The last piece should have the marmalade side face-down. Cut diagonally to make 4 "towers." Set aside.
Beat together egg and milk until light.
Melt butter in a saucepan. Dip "tower" sandwiches in egg-milk mixture, coating the surface evenly. Fry until golden on all sides. Transfer onto 2 to 4 plates.
Add sugar to remaining butter in pan and stir until melted. Add banana slices and cook until caramel-like and banana slices are coated. Spoon over fried bread with raspberries.

notes: Serving suggestion: Serve with whipped cream or ice cream as snack.

recipes.title: Fruity Breakfast Sundae

instructions.text: Divide ingredients into 4 portions each. In 2 parfait glasses or bowls, alternately layer yogurt, blueberries, peaches, mangoes and cornflakes, ending layers with cornflakes. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Use other fruits in season. Replace mango yogurt with your own preferred flavor.

recipes.title: Fruity Latvian Breakfast

instructions.text: Mash bananas with grapefruit juice until pasty. Add grapefruit pulp and remaining juice. Stir in wheat germ and linseeds. Transfer to individual bowls and top with boiling water until desired consistency is reached. Sweeten with honey to taste. Serve right away.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace grapefruit with pineapple (and pineapple juice), or apples (and apple cider). If using apples, blanch apples, peel skin with a vegetable peeler, remove core and chop coarsely. Soak in water until needed to prevent discoloration. Use apple cider instead of grapefruit juice.

recipes.title: Grilled Fruity Croissant Sandwich

ingredients.item: fresh strawberries, stems removed and halved
confectioner's sugar mixed with 1/4 tsp cinnamon

instructions.text: Slice each croissant lengthwise and spread about 1 tablespoon cream cheese on the base of each. Arrange strawberry halves over cream cheese and top with blueberries. Sprinkle with grated chocolate. Sprinkle top portions of croissants with grated chocolate. Grill fruit-filled bases and chocolate-sprinkled tops until chocolate is melted. Remove from heat and cover fruit-filled portions with top portions. Dust with confectioner's sugar mixed with cinnamon. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace cream cheese with apricot jam and substitute berries with orange segments or thinly sliced peaches or other fruit in season.

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Open-Faced Sandwiches

instructions.text: Melt butter in a non-stick pan. Combine eggs, chives, water, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring gently, until eggs are slightly set.

Spread filling over each half of the ciabatta. Top with slices of ham, 3 strips of bacon, tomatoes and grated cheese. Arrange on a baking sheet and broil until cheese melts, about 2 to 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Use white bread with crusts trimmed, if ciabatta is not available.

recipes.title: Hungarian Sausage Breakfast Wraps

instructions.text: Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Stir-fry sausage until slightly browned, about 3 to 5 minutes. Add onion and sauté for 2 minutes until soft. Add green pepper and stir fry for 1 minute. Pour in beaten eggs and season to taste. Gently stir until egg is set. Remove from heat.
Spread sour cream on warmed tortillas. Spoon sausage-egg filling over sour cream and sprinkle with grated cheese. Fold lower portion and sides of tortilla over filling and roll. Serve immediately.

notes: Serving suggestion: Substitute Hungarian sausage with your own choice of meat or cold cuts. Replace sour cream with mayonnaise. Add cayenne pepper to filling mixture for a spicy version.

recipes.title: Pita Breakfast Pizza

ingredients.item: whole strips of bacon, each cut in to 8 pieces

instructions.text: Spread spaghetti sauce over each tortilla. Divide bacon and pineapple equally among the tortilla. Sprinkle with mozzarella and bake in a pre-heated 375F oven for 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve hot or warm.

notes: Serving suggestion: Replace spaghetti sauce with sour cream and top with fruit and grated cheddar cheese.

recipes.title: Salmon and Rocket Sandwich
recipes.description: A tasty breakfast sandwich with smoked salmon, bacon, and fresh rocket.

instructions.text: Slice ciabatta lengthwise and toast until crisp.
Arrange smoked salmon slices on the base of bread and spread with cream cheese.
Top with bacon. Season with freshly ground black or cayenne pepper.
Arrange rocket leaves over bacon and cover with other half of ciabatta.
Cut crosswise and serve immediately.

notes: Replace salmon and bacon with your choice of cold cuts, replace rocket with other salad greens.

recipes.title: Spicy Breakfast Migas
recipes.description: A Tex-Mex breakfast dish with crispy tortillas and scrambled eggs.

instructions.text: Fry flour tortillas in oil over high heat until golden and crispy, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drain on paper towels and cut into cubes. If tortillas crumble, that's fine. Save the crumbs as well. Set aside.
