Whisk together eggs and half and half with seasonings as desired. Set aside.
Heat canola oil in large pan over medium heat. Sauté red onion until wilted, about 3 minutes.
Add red and green peppers and continue sautéing. Add tomatoes, and stir until tender but not soggy. Add jalapeño and stir a little.
Reduce heat to low and gradually pour in beaten egg mixture. Gently fold eggs into sautéed vegetables until set but not dry.
Sprinkle with cheese and cilantro and cook for another minute. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve warm.

notes: Omit jalapeño, if desired. Use other herbs you prefer.

recipes.title: Southern Grits
recipes.description: Classic Southern-style cheesy grits.

instructions.text: Pour water and salt in a pan. Place over medium heat and boil.
Gradually stir in grits and cook for 1 minute with constant stirring.
Reduce heat to low when mixture starts to boil. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Stir in pepper, butter and cheese until melted.

notes: Grits can be served with bacon or sausage, eggs, biscuits or toast.

recipes.title: Bacon and Tomato Frittata
recipes.description: A satisfying, hearty breakfast that is quick and easy to prepare.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper and garlic powder. Mix in the bacon and scallions and pour into the skillet. Layer with the tomato slices.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve.
Serve with a green salad for a light lunch or dinner.

recipes.title: Broccoli and Cheese Frittata
recipes.description: An easy to follow frittata recipe that is sure to be a crowd pleaser.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli and cook for 2 minutes.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper, garlic powder and scallions and pour over the broccoli.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat in the microwave before serving.

recipes.title: Cherry Chocolate Scones
recipes.description: These scones make a tasty breakfast treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.
Sift the flour and salt together in a large bowl. Rub in the butter. Mix in the chocolate and cherries.
Add the sugar, then milk and egg and combine to get a soft dough.
Knead the dough briefly on a lightly floured surface then roll out into a 1/2-inch thick round.
Divide and cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: If preferred, white chocolate chips can be used instead of the semi-sweet chocolate.

recipes.title: Apricot Scones
recipes.description: A delicious treat to go with your morning coffee.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.
Sift the flour, cinnamon and salt together in a large bowl. Rub in the butter. Mix in the apricots.
Add the sugar, then milk and egg and combine to get a soft dough.
Knead the dough briefly on a lightly floured surface then roll out into a 1/2-inch thick round.
Divide and cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to three days.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Oat Scones
recipes.description: A delicious lightly spiced scone. Serve for breakfast or as a teatime treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.
Mix the flours, oats, cinnamon and salt together in a large bowl. Rub in the butter.
Add the sugar, then milk, egg and maple syrup and combine to get a soft dough.
Knead the dough briefly on a lightly floured surface then roll out into a 1/2-inch thick round.
Divide and cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Add a handful of raisins to the dough if desired.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Scones
recipes.description: Pumpkin and chocolate pair beautifully together in this delicious scone.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Whisk together the flour, sugar, spices, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Blend the butter into the flour mixture slowly, using two knives or working with your fingers, until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Set aside.
In another bowl, combine the buttermilk, pumpkin puree, chocolate chips and vanilla and mix well. Add this to the dry ingredients and mix till dough is formed.
On a floured surface, gently knead the dough five or six times and pat into a circle that is about one and a half inches thick and seven inches wide.
Cut this circle into quarters, and then each quarter in half so you have eight scones. Beat the egg and milk together and brush over the tops of the scones.
Bake for 15 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Transfer to a wire rack and cool.

notes: Drizzle with chocolate syrup before serving.

recipes.title: Apple Cheddar Muffins
recipes.description: Cheddar and apple go well together in this tasty breakfast muffin.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the apple and cheese. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm with apple butter.

recipes.title: Banana Cinnamon Muffins
recipes.description: Delicious and moist to the last bite, these muffins will disappear quickly.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, banana and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm, drizzled with honey.

recipes.title: Raisin Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Delicious breakfast muffins that are a great source of fiber.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, wheat bran, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Mix in the raisins. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm with butter.

recipes.title: Raspberry Cheesecake Poppy Seed Muffins
recipes.description: Cream cheese and tart raspberries are a great match in these delicious, moist muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, cream cheese, poppy seeds and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the raspberries.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Use half a cup of chopped walnuts instead of poppy seeds if desired.

recipes.title: Triple Threat Berry Muffins
recipes.description: Muffins loaded with three types of berries and orange zest.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.

In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a medium bowl combine the sugar, egg, butter (cooled), and buttermilk. Lightly whisk together and combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients.
Gently fold in the berries and orange zest. Spoon batter into greased muffin tins. Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

notes: These taste great warm, so pop any leftovers into the microwave before serving.

recipes.title: Ginger Lemon Muffins
recipes.description: A great muffin to go with your morning coffee.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Combine the sugar, lemon zest and ginger in a food processor and pulse until well combined.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Add in the ginger and lemon zest mixture and mix well. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Cinnamon and Spice Muffins
recipes.description: These spiced muffins are great for breakfast, teatime or just a snack on the go.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, spices and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add half a cup of your favorite nuts to the batter before baking.

recipes.title: Apple Cranberry Muffins
recipes.description: This delicious and easy to follow recipe is sure to become a firm family favourite.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the apple and cranberries. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add half a cup of raisins to the batter before baking if desired.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Cherry Chocolate Muffins
recipes.description: A deliciously decadent breakfast time, snack time or anytime treat!

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the cherries and chocolate chips. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm topped with whipped cream for a delicious dessert.

recipes.title: Candy Cane Muffins
recipes.description: These candy cane muffins make a great Christmas morning treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and peppermint extract. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead. Sprinkle the tops with the crushed candy canes.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add 1/4 cup of cocoa to the batter for chocolate muffins.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Nutella Muffins
recipes.description: Deliciously moist to the last bite, these muffins are sure to disappear quickly.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and Nutella. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: If desired, add 1/4 cup of chopped walnuts to the batter before baking.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Maple Bacon Muffins
recipes.description: These savory muffins are great served warm for breakfast or even a snack.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and maple syrup. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the bacon. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: For a complete breakfast serve with a side of eggs.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Eggnog Muffins
recipes.description: These lightly spiced eggnog muffins are a great holiday treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, spices and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, eggnog and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: These muffins freeze well, just pop in the microwave for a couple minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Coconut Muffins
recipes.description: Definitely for coconut lovers - this light, moist muffin is sure to be a crowd pleaser.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Mix in the coconut. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Hash Brown Frittata
recipes.description: A filling frittata recipe that can be made for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the hash brown potatoes to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper and garlic powder and pour into the skillet over the hash browns. Layer the spinach over the egg mixture.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Traditional Blueberry Muffins
recipes.description: Classic blueberry muffins everyone will love.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the blueberries. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Banana Nut Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Moist banana muffins with crunchy walnuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, vanilla and mashed bananas. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the walnuts. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Morning Start Blueberry Oatmeal Muffins
recipes.description: Hearty oatmeal muffins studded with blueberries.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, oats, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the blueberries. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Muffins
recipes.description: Spiced pumpkin muffins perfect for fall.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, spices and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and pumpkin puree. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Strawberry Chocolate Muffins
recipes.description: Decadent muffins combining fresh strawberries and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the strawberries and chocolate chips. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Muffins
recipes.description: Classic muffins loaded with chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the chocolate chips. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Muffins
recipes.description: Rich and satisfying peanut butter muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and peanut butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
recipes.description: Light and tangy muffins with lemon and poppy seeds.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Mix in poppy seeds. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, lemon zest and lemon juice. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Cranberry Orange Muffins
recipes.description: Tart cranberries paired with sweet orange zest.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and orange zest. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the cranberries. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Streusel Muffins
recipes.description: Moist muffins topped with a crunchy cinnamon streusel.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Make streusel by combining brown sugar, 2 tbsp flour and cold butter. Set aside.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and melted butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups. Top with streusel.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Carrot Muffins
recipes.description: Moist and flavorful carrot muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Stir in the grated carrots. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Blueberry Crumble Muffins
recipes.description: Blueberry muffins with a delicious crumble topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Make crumble by combining brown sugar, 2 tbsp flour and cold butter. Set aside.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the blueberries. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups. Top with crumble.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Coffee Cake Muffins
recipes.description: Individual-sized coffee cakes in muffin form.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Make streusel by combining brown sugar, cinnamon and pecans. Set aside.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour half the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups. Sprinkle with half the streusel. Top with remaining batter and streusel.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Zucchini Muffins
recipes.description: A great way to use up summer zucchini.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Stir in the grated zucchini. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Applesauce Muffins
recipes.description: Moist and tender muffins made with applesauce.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and applesauce. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Pineapple Muffins
recipes.description: Tropical pineapple muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the pineapple. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Strawberry Muffins
recipes.description: Fresh and fruity strawberry muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the strawberries. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Muffins
recipes.description: Hearty and wholesome oatmeal muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, oats, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Classic high-fiber bran muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, bran, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Gingerbread Waffles
recipes.description: With wonderful warm spices, this seasonal waffle recipe is great for the festive season.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, spices and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and molasses. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Top with whipped cream and drizzle with molasses.

recipes.title: Norwegian Waffles
recipes.description: Deliciously light and fluffy waffles that are so easy to whip up.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Let the batter set for half an hour before cooking.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Spread with sour cream and jam to serve.

recipes.title: Cornmeal Waffles
recipes.description: These savory waffles are great served with a bowl of stew, chili or soup.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Garnish with sour cream and shredded cheddar cheese, serve with a bowl of chili.

recipes.title: Banana Waffles
recipes.description: These waffles are great as a snack, breakfast or dessert.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cinnamon, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk, banana and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: For a healthier option substitute half of the all-purpose flour with whole-wheat flour.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from breakfast category

recipes.title: Spiced Fruit and Nut Granola with Truvia Natural Sweetener

ingredients.item: golden raisins or dried figs, chopped

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°. In a medium bowl, combine the oats, wheat germ, Truvia natural sweetener, pumpkin pie spice and salt. Add both oils and toss well to coat. Spread in a single layer on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake until toasted, about 10 minutes. Stir in almonds and continue to bake until the nuts are toasted and the granola is dry, about 10 more minutes.
Remove from the oven, stir in the apricots, dates, and raisins or figs. Cool on the baking sheet. Serve over yogurt as desired. Store granola in a sealed container for up to 2 weeks.

notes: May substitute with 7 packets Truvia natural sweetener

recipes.title: Reduced-Sugar Blueberry Muffins with Truvia Natural Sweetener

instructions.text: Assemble all ingredients; preheat oven to 400°.
Combine flour, baking powder, Truvia natural sweetener, sugar and salt in a medium bowl.
Combine milk, egg substitute, oil and vanilla in a large bowl. Mix until well combined.
Add dry ingredients to egg mixture. Mix until just moistened. Do not overmix.
Fold in blueberries.
Divide batter into twelve 2 1/2-inch paper-lined muffin cups.
Bake for 18-22 minutes, until tops are lightly browned.

notes: May substitute with 12 packets Truvia natural sweetener
May substitute 1 large egg; will alter nutrition facts

recipes.title: Cranberry Cornmeal Pancakes with Glazed Oranges

instructions.text: Mix cranberries and 1/4 cup juice from 1 orange. Microwave in a bowl until plump, on high, 45 seconds. Grate 1/2 teaspoon zest from 1 orange. Peel and pit 2 oranges, then segment oranges over a bowl to catch juice.

In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt. Separately, whisk buttermilk, eggs, canola oil, 3 teaspoons Truvia natural sweetener and orange zest until smooth. Combine wet ingredients with dry. Fold in cranberry mixture.

Heat a heavy non-stick skillet over medium heat until a drop of water sizzles around the pan. Drop 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake onto the hot skillet. Cook until bubbles form on the top of each pancake and the bottoms brown, 4 minutes. Flip and cook (adjust the heat if needed) until other side is golden, 1 to 2 minutes. Keep pancakes warm.
Simmer remaining juice and 3/4 teaspoon Truvia natural sweetener. Add butter and orange segments. Toss, 1 minute. Add mint. Top pancakes with glazed oranges. Serve.

notes: May substitute with 12 packets Truvia natural sweetener

missing_inputs: 1/4 cup loosely packed mint leaves, torn

recipes.title: Blueberry Ricotta Blintzes with Truvia Natural Sweetener

instructions.text: For blintzes: Mix flour, milk, 1/4 cup water, egg, Truvia natural sweetener, and salt in a blender until smooth. Add melted butter and pulse. Set aside for 30 minutes.
For filling: Combine ricotta and cream cheese in mixer. Add egg, Truvia natural sweetener and lemon zest; beat until smooth.

Pour 2 tablespoons batter onto a non-stick skillet on medium. Swirl pan to make a thin pancake and cook until bottom is golden, about 1 minute. Cool on wax paper. Spoon 2 tablespoons of 1/3 cheese filling on lower of each blintz. Fold sides over the filling and fold bottom into a tight package. Bake on a baking sheet, seam side down, at 350° for 20 minutes.

For compote: Combine 1 cup blueberries, 1/3 cup water and Truvia natural sweetener in a saucepan. Simmer over medium heat, stirring frequently, until thickened, 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup blueberries and lemon juice. Serve blintzes warm with compote.

notes: May substitute with 2 packets Truvia natural sweetener
May substitute with 1 1/2 packets

recipes.title: Cherry Walnut Stuffed French Toast with Cinnamon Apples

ingredients.item: red apples, such as Macintosh, cored and diced
slices Pepperidge Farm 80 Calorie Cinnamon Swirl Bread

instructions.text: Combine apples, 4 tablespoons water, 1 teaspoon Truvia natural sweetener, and cinnamon in a bowl. Microwave 6 minutes, covered, until apples are tender. Toss.

In a medium bowl, stir together the cream cheese, walnuts, cherries, 1 teaspoon Truvia natural sweetener and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla. Put 4 slices bread on a cutting board and evenly spread with cream cheese mixture, about 1/4 cup per slice. Firmly press a second piece on top of each to form a sandwich.

In shallow bowl, whisk milk, eggs, 1 teaspoon Truvia natural sweetener, vanilla and salt. Heat a heavy non-stick skillet over medium heat. Soak sandwiches in the milk mixture for 1 minute, flip and press edges together. Drip off excess. Brown and crisp sides for 8-10 minutes. Top with apples.

notes: May substitute with 3 1/4 packets Truvia natural sweetener

recipes.title: Cheese Omelet with Roasted Tomatoes and Onions

ingredients.item: plum tomatoes, trimmed and halved crosswise
small white onion, sliced into 4 rounds
kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
mixed chopped herbs (such as parsley and dill) and/or scallions
shredded gruyère or Swiss cheese (about 1 cup)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450°. Brush a baking dish with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Season the tomatoes and onion rounds with salt and pepper and add to the dish, cut-side up. Mix the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil with the panko and sprinkle over the tomatoes and onion. Bake until tender and golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.

Whisk the eggs, milk and herbs in a bowl; season with salt and pepper. Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 teaspoon butter, swirling to coat. When the foam subsides, add one-quarter of the egg mixture. Cook 10 seconds, then move a rubber spatula around the edge of the pan until the mixture is just set, about 1 minute. Scatter one-quarter of the cheese down the center, then fold the omelet in half. Cook about 30 more seconds, or to desired doneness. Transfer to a plate. Repeat to make 3 more omelets. Serve with the roasted tomatoes and onions.

recipes.title: Nigella Lawson's Apple Latkes
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine December 2010 - From Feast by Nigella Lawson

ingredients.item: plain Greek yogurt plus ½ cup low-fat milk, or ¾ cup plain yogurt
apples (½ pound), to make 1 cup grated apples
maple syrup (or confectioners' sugar and ground cinnamon), for serving

instructions.text: Beat the egg with the yogurt and milk (or just the yogurt, if you're using the plain variety) and set aside. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and sugar in a bowl. Peel, quarter and core the apples, then grate them. I use a food processor, but a coarse Microplane or other grater would work easily. I'd imagine.
Pour the yogurt mixture into the flour bowl; tip in the grated apples and fold it together.

Pour enough oil to come about ¼ inch up in a skillet and put on the stove to heat. Dollop spoonfuls—use a round soup spoon—of the apple batter into the sizzling oil, a rubber spatula (the one you used to fold the batter together) will help you scrape the batter off the spoon and press down on the little latkes in the pan. Don't worry about making perfect round pancakes; I like these a bit raggedy and skew-whiff. Fry for a minute or two, until the latkes are a golden brown on the undersides; you can see from the top as they start firming up underneath. Flip them with 2 metal spatulas and fry for another minute on the uncooked side.
Remove to a tray lined with paper towels to blot the excess oil and continue cooking until you've used up all the batter. Top with maple syrup.

recipes.title: Eggo Waffles with Spiced Apple Compote
recipes.description: Cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice-seasoned apples lend the flavors of fall to warm waffles.

ingredients.item: baking apples, peeled, cored and cut into ½-inch pieces

instructions.text: In small saucepan combine apples, sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice. Cook and stir over medium-high heat about 5 minutes or until slightly softened. Reduce heat to medium. Cook, covered, for 12 to 15 minutes or until softened, stirring occasionally. Chill, if desired.
Prepare Kellogg's Eggo Homestyle Waffles according to package directions. Serve warm with apple mixture on side.

notes: Chill, if desired.
Serve warm with apple mixture on side.

recipes.title: Pancakes
recipes.description: Classic fluffy pancakes - a simple breakfast staple.

instructions.text: Sift the flour, baking powder, salt and caster sugar into a bowl.
Break the eggs into a separate bowl and whisk together with the milk.
Gradually add the milk and egg mixture to the flour mixture and whisk to a smooth batter.
Heat a frying pan over a medium heat and melt a small knob of butter. Pour the batter into the pan, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
When the top of the pancake begins to bubble, turn and cook the other side until golden brown.
Serve with butter and maple syrup.

recipes.title: Breakfast Burrito Omelet
recipes.description: A creative fusion - an omelet wrapped in a warm tortilla for a quick breakfast burrito.

instructions.text: Crack eggs in bowl, add water, salt, pepper, and herbs. Mix well.
Heat tortilla in a pan for 10 seconds per side. Set aside and keep warm.
Melt butter in pan, pour egg mixture, cook on low. Pull edges to let uncooked egg flow to sides.
When set, add desired fillings. Slide omelet onto warm tortilla.
Fold tortilla from sides to seal. Cut in half and serve.

recipes.title: Whole Grain Pancakes with Blueberry Sauce
recipes.description: Healthy whole grain pancakes served with homemade blueberry sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat a lightly greased pancake griddle or a large skillet.
Mix all pancake ingredients together. Cook on the hot griddle.
Combine the sauce ingredients in a medium pan; cook over medium high heat, stirring frequently.
Sauce should gradually thicken. Serve hot over pancakes.

recipes.title: Buckwheat Pancakes
recipes.description: Hearty buckwheat pancakes with a nutty flavor.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together with a whisk.
Cook on a preheated lightly greased griddle or skillet.
Flip when bubbles begin to form on one side.
Serve hot with butter and warmed maple syrup.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Pancakes
recipes.description: Fluffy pancakes studded with mini chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Heat a griddle or a large skillet to medium high; lightly grease.
Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, eggs, oil and buttermilk.
Whisk until well combined. Cook pancakes on hot griddle. Before flipping, sprinkle on a few chocolate chips.
Flip the pancakes when bubbles start to form, about 1 minute.
Serve pancakes hot with butter, warmed syrup and a sprinkling of powdered sugar.

recipes.title: German Pancakes
recipes.description: Oven-baked puffy pancakes with lemon and powdered sugar.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Place shortening in a large cast iron skillet and place in oven for about 7 minutes.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, salt and sugar.
In another bowl, bring together the butter, eggs, milk and vanilla. Add the juice and zest of one lemon.
Place batter in greased skillet and bake for about 20-25 minutes, until the pancake puffs up.
Remove from oven and loosen the pancake with a spatula.
Place the pancake on a large plate. Dust with powdered sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Lemon Blueberry Pancakes
recipes.description: Tangy lemon pancakes with fresh blueberries.

instructions.text: Preheat a pancake griddle.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Cook on the preheated griddle.
Serve hot with butter and warmed syrup.

recipes.title: Silver Dollars
recipes.description: Mini buttermilk pancakes perfect for kids.

instructions.text: Preheat a pancake griddle to high. Spray lightly with cooking spray.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Using a 1/4 cup measuring cup, drop batter onto griddle. Cook until batter begins to bubble and then flip to cook on the other side.
Serve immediately with soft butter and warmed syrup.

recipes.title: Two Berry Pancakes
recipes.description: Blueberry pancakes topped with homemade strawberry sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat a pancake griddle or a large cast iron pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, 2 tablespoons of sugar and the salt.
Add the eggs, buttermilk, vanilla and butter.
Fold in the blueberries.
Grill on the preheated griddle.
In a small saucepan, bring to a boil the remaining ingredients until the mixture thickens.
Drizzle the strawberry sauce over the blueberry pancakes. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Spice Cakes
recipes.description: Spiced pancakes with cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.

instructions.text: Preheat a pancake griddle.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Whisk together until well combined. Cook pancakes and serve hot with butter, warmed syrup and a sprinkle of powdered sugar if desired.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pancakes
recipes.description: Fluffy pumpkin spiced pancakes perfect for fall.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle to high.
Combine all ingredients and whisk together.
Cook pancakes and serve hot with warmed maple syrup and butter.

recipes.title: Banana Sour Cream Pancakes
recipes.description: Moist pancakes with mashed bananas and sour cream.

instructions.text: Preheat a greased griddle to high.
Combine all ingredients, whisking to combine.
Cook pancakes, about 2 minutes on each side.
Serve hot with warmed syrup, butter, jam or peanut butter.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Chocolate Pancakes
recipes.description: Chocolate pancakes with cinnamon and mini chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and cook on a preheated greased griddle.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Toasted Pecan Blueberry Pancakes
recipes.description: Whole wheat pancakes with blueberries topped with cinnamon toasted pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toast the nuts by spreading them out on a lightly greased cookie sheet.
Melt the butter and cinnamon in the microwave and drizzle over pecans. Toast for about 10-15 minutes or until they lightly browned and crispy.
Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar with a whisk.
Stir in the eggs, milk and oil.
Fold in the blueberries.
Drop pancake batter on griddle, about 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Top pancakes with toasted cinnamon pecans.

recipes.title: Blueberry Buckwheat Pancakes
recipes.description: Hearty buckwheat pancakes loaded with blueberries.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and whisk together.
Cook on a hot griddle. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Banana Blueberry Pancakes
recipes.description: Mashed banana pancakes with blueberries and a hint of cloves.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients and cook pancakes on a hot griddle.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Monkey Pancakes
recipes.description: Banana chocolate chip pancakes - a kid favorite!

instructions.text: Heat a large skillet or pancake griddle.
Combine ingredients with a whisk, folding in chocolate chips with a spatula.
Cook pancakes.
Drizzle tops of pancakes with honey, maple syrup and peanut butter.

recipes.title: Cornmeal and Berry Pancakes
recipes.description: Light cornmeal pancakes with fresh berries and honey butter.

instructions.text: Preheat a greased griddle.
In a medium bowl, mix the flour, cornmeal, salt and baking powder with a whisk.
In another bowl combine the eggs with the applesauce.
Add the oil and milk to the egg mixture.
Combine the wet ingredients into the dry.
Cook the pancakes on the griddle. In a small bowl, stir the honey and butter together.
Melt the honey butter in the microwave for 20 seconds or until melted and smooth.
Serve pancakes hot with honey butter and fresh berries.

recipes.title: Maple Bacon Pancakes
recipes.description: Savory bacon pancakes with maple flavor.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle with butter.
Dice the bacon; cook in a medium skillet. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon, draining excess fat.
In a medium bowl combine the remaining ingredients to make the pancake batter; add the bacon to the batter.
Cook the pancakes on a griddle. Serve hot with your favorite maple syrup.

recipes.title: Toasted Pecan Buttermilk Pancakes
recipes.description: Fluffy buttermilk pancakes with toasted pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat an oven to 400°F.
Spread pecans out on a baking sheet.
Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly toasted.
In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
Cook pancakes and serve hot with syrup, jam or peanut butter.

recipes.title: Autumn Spiced Pumpkin Pancakes
recipes.description: Whole wheat pumpkin spiced pancakes topped with warmed apple butter.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle with butter.
Combine the flours, baking powder, salt and spices in a medium bowl.
Whisk in the eggs, vanilla and milk.
Grill up the pancakes on the preheated griddle.
Top with warmed apple butter and serve.

recipes.title: Healthy Apple Wheat Pancakes
recipes.description: Whole wheat pancakes with apple pieces, honey and applesauce.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle or skillet.
In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt.
In another bowl whisk together the eggs and honey.
Add the vegetable oil, applesauce, cinnamon and milk.
Stir together the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients.
Fold in the apples.
Grill the pancakes and serve immediately with sugar free jam.

recipes.title: Citrus Blueberry Pancakes
recipes.description: Light pancakes with lemon and orange citrus flavor.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and whisk together.
Preheat a skillet and coat with cooking spray.
Cook pancakes and serve hot with your favorite syrup.

recipes.title: Apple Ginger Pancakes
recipes.description: Spiced pancakes with cinnamon, ginger, and diced apple.

instructions.text: Preheat a non-stick griddle.
Combine batter ingredients and cook pancakes. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Oven Apple Pancakes
recipes.description: A great hassle-free pancake breakfast baked in the oven.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Add the butter to a 13x9-inch ovenproof dish and place in the oven until the butter melts. Remove the dish from the oven and swirl the butter around so that the entire base of the dish is coated.
Add the apples to the dish, spreading them out evenly. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and bake until the apple slices start to soften slightly, about ten minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl whisk together the milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt. Add the flour and keep whisking until the batter is smooth.
Pour the batter over the apples and bake for a further 20 minutes, until the pancake is puffed and golden brown.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve with syrup and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

recipes.title: Old Fashioned Belgium Waffles
recipes.description: Classic Belgian waffles with crispy exterior and fluffy interior.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Cook on a lightly greased Belgium waffle maker for about 5 to 8 minutes.
Serve hot with butter and maple syrup.

recipes.title: Waffles with Strawberries and Whip Cream
recipes.description: Buttermilk waffles topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.

instructions.text: Heat and lightly grease a waffle maker.
Whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add in the eggs, buttermilk and butter and mix until combined.
Pour batter on the waffle maker.
Cook for about 5 to 8 minutes.
Top waffles with whip cream, fresh strawberries and a sprinkle of lemon zest. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Waffles
recipes.description: Healthy whole wheat waffles with applesauce and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Cook in a preheated and lightly greased waffle iron. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Waffles with Summer Berries
recipes.description: Classic waffles topped with sugared fresh summer berries.

instructions.text: Preheat a waffle maker.
Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, 2 tablespoons of sugar, milk, eggs and butter.
Combine all berries together and mix with remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar; set aside.
Grill the waffles.
Top with sugared berries. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Peaches and Cream Waffles
recipes.description: Light cake flour waffles with fresh peaches and vanilla whipped cream.

instructions.text: Preheat a griddle.
Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar and salt.
Whisk in the eggs, oil and buttermilk.
Fold in the peaches. In another bowl, beat the cream with the vanilla with an electric mixer until peaks form; set aside.
Cook the pancakes. Serve hot with whip cream on the top.

recipes.title: Yeast Waffles
recipes.description: These waffles require a bit of extra effort as the batter needs to be chilled overnight but the results are so worth it, a light and fluffy yet crisp waffle.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and chill overnight.
Stir the batter and ladle into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Top with whipped cream and strawberries to serve.

recipes.title: Gingerbread Waffles
recipes.description: With wonderful warm spices, this seasonal waffle recipe is great for the festive season.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, spices and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and molasses. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Top with whipped cream and drizzle with molasses.

recipes.title: Chocolate Waffles
recipes.description: Start your day right with this decadent breakfast treat.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, cocoa and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Fold in the chocolate chips.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve with butter and maple syrup.

recipes.title: Norwegian Waffles
recipes.description: Deliciously light and fluffy waffles that are so easy to whip up.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Let the batter set for half an hour before cooking.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Spread with sour cream and jam to serve.

recipes.title: Cornmeal Waffles
recipes.description: These savory waffles are great served with a bowl of stew, chili or soup.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Garnish with sour cream and shredded cheddar cheese, serve with a bowl of chili.

recipes.title: Banana Waffles
recipes.description: These waffles are great as a snack, breakfast or dessert.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cinnamon, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk, banana and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: For a healthier option substitute half of the all-purpose flour with whole-wheat flour.

recipes.title: Bananas Foster Waffles
recipes.description: Light and crunchy waffles topped with sweet banana come together beautifully.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.

For the topping: In a saucepan, mix butter, sugar, all spice, maple syrup and rum extract (if using). Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the bananas, coating them with the sauce and cook for a further 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
To serve, spoon the banana mixture over each waffle and garnish with the pecans.

notes: Serve with a dollop of whipped cream over the top.

recipes.title: Anise Waffles
recipes.description: Anise lends a wonderful licorice-like flavor to these unique waffles.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and anise extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Sprinkle with powdered sugar to serve.

recipes.title: Maple Walnut Waffles
recipes.description: Crispy on the outside, soft and full of maple flavor on the inside, these waffles are sure to go down a treat.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and maple syrup. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Fold in the walnuts.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve drizzled with syrup and butter.

recipes.title: Apple Cinnamon Waffles
recipes.description: These lightly spiced apple waffles are sure to become a family favorite.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, cinnamon and baking powder and set aside.
Beat the eggs until fluffy. Add in the butter, milk and vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Fold in the grated apple.
Ladle the batter into a heated waffle iron that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Cook waffles until crisp and golden.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve topped with apple chunks sautéed in butter.

recipes.title: Traditional Crepes
recipes.description: Classic French crepes served with powdered sugar and jam.

instructions.text: Preheat a medium skillet to medium high. Coat pan with cooking spray.
Combine the flour and eggs together in a medium bowl. Alternately add the milk and water. Stir in the salt and butter until well combined.
Measure about 1/4 cup of batter and place in hot skillet.
Allow to cook for about 10 minutes or until the bottom is lightly browned.
Carefully flip the crepe over cool on the other side.
Fold the crepe in half and then in half again.
Remove to a serving dish.
Top with powdered sugar and your favorite jam. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Vanilla Crepes
recipes.description: These French-style pancakes are so versatile as they can be dressed up with any of your favorite fillings.

instructions.text: Sift the flour, sugar and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and vanilla and beat until smooth.

Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Holding the pan by the handle, quickly swirl the batter around so that it coats the entire base of the pan.

Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Using a spatula, loosen the crepe, turn and cook on the other side. This side will cook much quicker, around 30 seconds.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve filled with sweetened ricotta.

recipes.title: Strawberry Crepes
recipes.description: These crepes are filled with syrupy strawberries and whipped cream.

instructions.text: For the crepes: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
For the filling: Add the sugar, strawberries and butter to another non-stick pan on medium heat. Stir until the sugar and butter thicken, then add the strawberry syrup and mix well.
To assemble: Add the strawberry mixture to each crepe and roll up. Top with a dollop of the whipped cream and serve immediately.

notes: For a quick crepe filling use canned cherry or apple pie filling.

recipes.title: Banana Crepes
recipes.description: These delicious crepes can be made in minutes from simple, everyday ingredients.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and sliced thick, for filling

instructions.text: For the crepes: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
For the filling: Add the sugar, bananas and butter to another non-stick pan on medium heat. Cook until caramelized and golden.
To assemble: Add the banana mixture to each crepe and roll up. Drizzle with the chocolate sauce and serve immediately.

notes: Caramel sauce also goes really well with banana and can be used instead of the chocolate.

recipes.title: Raspberry Crepes
recipes.description: This is an easy to follow recipe for crepes, that can be served for breakfast or dessert.

instructions.text: For the crepes: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
For the filling: Mix the raspberry jam and vanilla extract together.
To assemble: Spoon a tablespoon of the raspberry mix onto each crepe and roll up. Top with a dollop of the whipped cream and serve immediately.

notes: Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

recipes.title: Blueberry Crepes
recipes.description: Delicate crepes filled with pillows of whipped cream accompanied by warm blueberry sauce.

instructions.text: For the crepes: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
For the filling: Add the sugar, blueberries and lemon juice to another non-stick pan on medium heat. Cover and cook until fruit is tender, about 10 minutes.
To assemble: Fill the crepe with whipped cream and roll up. Drizzle with the blueberry sauce. Serve immediately.

notes: While cooking the rest of your batter, stack cooked crepes in an ovenproof dish and keep warm in the oven at 190°F.

recipes.title: Egg White Crepes
recipes.description: A healthier, lighter crepe that is a good base for sweet or savory fillings.

instructions.text: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the egg whites.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the oil and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
Serve immediately.

notes: Fill with sweetened cream cheese and strawberries to serve.

recipes.title: Chocolate Hazelnut Crepes
recipes.description: These delicious crepes are so quick to throw together yet look and taste divine.

instructions.text: For the crepes: Sift the flour and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
To assemble: Spread each crepe with the hazelnut spread and roll up. Top with whipped cream and serve immediately.

notes: Add slices of banana to the filling if desired.

recipes.title: Vegan Crepes
recipes.description: Delicate, light crepes that are suitable for dairy-free, egg-free and vegan diets.

instructions.text: Sift the flour, sugar and salt into a large mixing bowl. Set aside.
In another bowl combine the soymilk, coconut milk, water and soy margarine. Gradually add to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.

Heat up a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and lightly grease with soy margarine. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 1 minute. Flip and cook the other side.
Serve immediately.

notes: Fill with your favorite fruit to serve.

recipes.title: Chocolate Crepes
recipes.description: These chocolate crepes make a great base for any dessert filling.

instructions.text: Sift the flour, cocoa and salt into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the eggs.
Add the milk in gradually and keep stirring to combine. Add in the butter and beat until smooth.
Heat up a lightly oiled non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Ladle the batter into the middle of the heated pan, using about 1/4 cup for each crepe. Quickly swirl the batter around.
Cook the crepe until the batter dries and the bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side, around 30 seconds.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve filled with whipped cream and nuts.

recipes.title: Western Omelet
recipes.description: This is a favorite omelet. Cut the omelet in two to create sandwiches, if desired.

ingredients.prep_note: chopped (or use onion if not available)

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a skillet.
Whisk together the eggs with all of the other ingredients.
Pour egg mix into skillet.
Cook one side, flip, and cook the other.
Don't overcook the omelet.

recipes.title: Asparagus Omelet
recipes.description: A delicious way to get a veggie in at breakfast time.

instructions.text: Cook asparagus until they are tender.
Whisk the eggs with salt, pepper, and milk.
For each omelet, butter a skillet and add half a cup of egg mix.
Don't scramble, just lift the edges occasionally and move the mixture around in the skillet.
Add 1/4 cup of cheese and 4 asparagus spears to one side of the omelet.
Flip the other half of the omelet over the asparagus.
Cook until done and season with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Vegetable Omelet
recipes.description: This omelet is deliciously healthy – a great way to sneak some veggies to the kids.

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the vegetables, salt and pepper and cook until done.
Add the tomatoes.
Beat the eggs and milk in a bowl.
Using another skillet, add the butter and pour in the eggs.
Cook until eggs are still soft but set. Add the vegetables and fold the omelet.

recipes.title: Eggs Benedict
recipes.description: Breakfast doesn't get any more special than this.

instructions.text: Use a double boiler for the Hollandaise sauce. Mix the egg yolks and lemon juice on the top. Add 3 tablespoons of butter. Mix vigorously.
Place the water in the bottom and bring to boil.
Add the rest of the butter and continue beating. Beat until sauce thickens.
Remove the double boiler from stove. Add salt and pepper to the sauce.
Spread out the ham on a baking dish and bake for 8 minutes, until the edges brown.
Pour water into a pan and bring to boil. Crack the eggs and carefully slide them into the water.
Lower the heat and cook eggs for about 3 to 4 minutes.
Place the muffins on individual plates.
Place 2 ham slices and an egg on each half. Drizzle with the sauce.

recipes.title: Eggs Florentine
recipes.description: This is as elegant as the Eggs Benedict, but you can feel self-righteous and smug 'cause you're using spinach.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Use a skillet to melt the butter. Mix in the flour, salt and pepper and blend with a wooden spoon or whisk.
Lower the heat and mix in the milk. Stir continuously as the mixture gets thick.
Lightly butter a muffin pan. Add 2 teaspoons of water to each muffin cup.
Crack the eggs and slide one into each cup.
Bake the eggs for 15 minutes.
While eggs are baking, heat the spinach in a microwave and drain the liquid.
Butter a 9 x 13 baking dish. Transfer the spinach to the baking dish. Divide the eggs over the spinach. Spread the sauce and the parmesan cheese over the eggs.
Bake eggs for 5 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and just turning brown.

recipes.title: Breakfast in a Skillet
recipes.description: A breakfast indulgence with bacon, potatoes, and eggs. You can substitute ham for the bacon.

instructions.text: Fry the bacon in a skillet and drain.
Use the drippings in the skillet to cook the onion and potatoes for approximately 5 minutes.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl and add to the skillet. Stir until eggs are cooked.
Season with salt and pepper.
Top the eggs with the bacon pieces and the cheese. Let the cheese melt.

notes: Can substitute ham for bacon

recipes.title: Egg Croquettes
recipes.description: Feeling a little French? Try these delicious eggs.

instructions.text: Mix the chopped boiled eggs with the parsley.
Use a skillet to heat the butter and sauté the onions until they are softened.
Add the flour and milk to the skillet. Keep stirring until the mixture thickens.
Mix in the Cheddar cheese and salt and pepper. Add the chopped boiled eggs.
Refrigerate for 3 hours.
Use your hands to form eggs in cylindrical patties. Roll patties in the bread crumbs to coat.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet and cook patties until they turn brown, around 2 minutes.

notes: Requires 3 hours refrigeration time

recipes.title: Mexican Eggs
recipes.description: Try these when you're in the mood for something a little different.

instructions.text: Beat the eggs. Add the beans and cheese.
Scramble the eggs until done.
Top the eggs with the salsa.

recipes.title: Croque Madame
recipes.description: Another treat from France. They really know their food.

instructions.text: Use half of the butter to spread on each slice of bread.
Pile a slice of ham and cheese on top of the bread and create sandwiches using the remaining bread slices.
Fry the sandwiches in a skillet. The cheese should be melted and the bread should be browned.
Prepare the eggs: Place enough water in a pan to cover the eggs and add a tsp of olive oil.
Boil the water, then lower the temperature to a simmer.
Crack the eggs and slide carefully into the water.
Turn off the stove and let the eggs sit until poached – 3 to 4 minutes.
Use a slotted spoon to remove the poached eggs to a plate.
Melt the remaining half of the butter and add the parsley.
Transfer one sandwich each to 4 serving plates. Top the sandwich with one poached egg.
Lightly pour the butter mix over the sandwiches.
Serve while hot.

recipes.title: Eggs and Spinach
recipes.description: Serve this when you have company for brunch.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Use a skillet to heat the oil and sauté the garlic.
Mix in the tomatoes, salt and pepper. Let tomatoes warm, about 4 minutes.
Add spinach leaves and continue to cook for another minute.
Place mixture in a 9 x 13 baking dish.
Whip eggs white until they are fluffy. Spread over spinach.
Use a spoon to transfer the egg yolks onto the spinach.
Bake for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Huevos Rancheros
recipes.description: Spice up your breakfast with this great south-of-border dish.

instructions.text: Toast the tortillas by placing each one in a skillet on medium heat. Cook both sides for 30 seconds. The tortilla should be soft.
Place the tortillas on a platter.
Melt the butter in a skillet.
Beat the eggs, salt and milk in a bowl. Cook in the skillet.
Transfer two warm tortillas on each plate and divide the scrambled eggs between them.

notes: Serve with: chopped scallions and/or tomatoes, finely grated cheese, chopped peppers, salsa, guacamole

recipes.title: Texas Eggs
recipes.description: This is perfect for those who love it hot!

instructions.text: Heat up the salsa in a skillet.
Crack the eggs on top of the salsa. Season to taste.
Transfer the salsa and eggs to individual dinner plates.
Serve with the tortilla chips, sour cream, avocado, and cilantro.

recipes.title: Baked Eggs
recipes.description: Baked eggs are a great alternative to sunny side up, and these are perfect for brunch entertaining.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
Mix the herbs and garlic in a bowl.
Whip together the butter and cream in another bowl.
Prepare a baking sheet with 6 ramekins.
Add the butter mix to the ramekins.
Bake for 2 minutes.
Take baking sheet with ramekins out of oven.
Crack the eggs and carefully slide one into each ramekin.
Add the herbs and the ricotta on top of the eggs.
Season with the salt and pepper.
Bake the eggs for 5 minutes.
Serve the baked eggs immediately.

recipes.title: Polenta and Eggs
recipes.description: Polenta is so creamy, and the eggs just add to the flavor.

instructions.text: Place the dried tomatoes in some boiling water and let soak.
Heat up the milk and broth in a saucepan. Add the cornmeal and keep whisking.
Have heat on medium and stir several times for about 15 minutes.
Add the Parmesan and blend. Let sit over low heat.
Remove the dried tomatoes from the water and drain them.
Heat the oil in a skillet. Toss in dried tomatoes and onions. Cook until onions are softened, then take off stove.
Use a deep pan and fill it halfway with water. Squeeze in the juice of the lemon.
When water is simmering, crack the eggs and transfer them carefully into the pan. Let the eggs simmer for 4 minutes, then removed and drain on a paper towel.
Transfer the polenta into individual serving dishes. Top each dish with 2 eggs.

recipes.title: Kale and Swiss Cheese Omelette
recipes.description: This omelette is the perfect weekend breakfast indulgence.

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and kale and sauté until the onion is soft and the kale is wilted, about 5 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Whisk the eggs together with the milk and season with salt and pepper.
Add the eggs to the pan and cook until just starting to set, then sprinkle with the kale mixture and top with the cheese.
Cook until egg is set and cheese is melted, then flip half the omelette over and cook for a further minute to set.
Slide onto a plate and serve immediately.

notes: Serve with bacon for a hearty breakfast

recipes.title: Johnnycakes
recipes.description: Make enough of these because people will gobble them up.

instructions.text: Mix the cornmeal and the salt.
Warm up the milk and water. Pour into cornmeal mix.
Butter a skillet and a tablespoon to drop the batter.
Fry the johnnycakes until browned on both sides.
Serve with applesauce or butter.

recipes.title: Apple Pancakes
recipes.description: These taste incredible and are fun to watch as they deflate.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and cut into small, thin slices

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Mix together the cinnamon and sugar.
In another bowl, whip the eggs, flour, milk, salt, and vanilla until the mixture is smooth.
Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the apples and the cinnamon sugar. Stir and cook for 5 minutes.
Place the batter in a baking dish. Pour the apples on top on the batter.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Flip the pancake upside down on a plate. Once the pancake deflates (it will) cut and serve.

recipes.title: Almond Pancakes
recipes.description: These pancakes are absolutely delicious. Serve with butter or syrup.

instructions.text: Mix together the flours, oats, baking soda and salt.
Use a second bowl to stir together the eggs and buttermilk.
Mix the egg/milk mixture into the flour and stir until all ingredients are well-blended.
Grease a skillet and add a quarter cup of batter. Top the batter with some almonds.
Cook the pancake until browned on one side, then flip.
Repeat with the rest of the batter.

recipes.title: Belgian Waffles
recipes.description: Try these light and fluffy Belgian waffles when you have company. They'll never leave.

instructions.text: Preheat the waffle iron.
Sift the flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl.
In another bowl, beat the yolks and sugar until well-blended. Mix in the vanilla, butter, and milk and use a whisk to mix.
Add the egg mix to the flour mix. Blend well.
Whip the egg whites with a hand mixer. Fold the egg whites into the batter.
Spray the waffle iron with the vegetable spray.
Transfer some of the batter to the waffle iron.
Cook until waffles are nice and brown.

recipes.title: Chocolate Waffle
recipes.description: Waffles are a Sunday treat that everyone loves.

instructions.text: Preheat a waffle iron.
Mix together the flour, cocoa, baking powder, and salt.
Use another bowl to beat the eggs, vanilla, and butter. Add the buttermilk and mix.
Mix in the chocolate chips and combine.
Let batter sit for 10 minutes.
Spray the waffle iron with vegetable spray.
Transfer batter to waffle iron.
Cook until waffles are golden brown on each side.
Repeat with all of the batter. Keep the waffles warm.

recipes.title: Quiche
recipes.description: Quiches are tasty and easy to make.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Mix together the eggs, ham, half-and-half, nutmeg, and cheese. Season to taste.
Transfer the eggs to the pre-made crust.
Bake for 35 minutes.

recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Quiche, Crepes and Souffles

recipes.title: Filled Crepes
recipes.description: Crepes are lighter than pancakes and so delicious. You can experiment with the filling.

instructions.text: Mix together the milk, flour, baking powder and chill overnight.
Melt half of the butter in a crepe pan. Add 1/4 cup of the batter.
Turn and rotate the crepe pan. Cook until one side is a golden brown, then flip and cook the other side.
Repeat until batter is used up.
Melt the remaining butter and saute the mushrooms and the onions. Mix in the ham, and add the flour and the milk to thicken the filling.
Divide the filling between the crepes. Roll the crepe closed.

notes: Requires overnight chilling
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Quiche, Crepes and Souffles

recipes.title: Cheese Souffle
recipes.description: Souffles taste divine and they make an impressive presentation.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Butter a 2-qrt souffle dish. Dust the bottom of the dish with the Parmesan cheese.
Use a saucepan to melt the butter. Add both flours. Mix vigorously.
While continuing to whisk, add the cream and water. Add the remaining Parmesan, the cheddar, and the salt and pepper.
Stir until mixture boils.
Take the saucepan off the stove and add the yolks. Whisk until integrated.
Pour the mixture in a bowl and let sit.
Beat the egg whites with a hand mixer for 5 minutes.
Fold the egg whites into the egg mixture.
Transfer the soufflé into the soufflé dish.
Bake for 40 minutes.

recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Quiche, Crepes and Souffles

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Soufflé
recipes.description: The right ingredients make this a wonderful soufflé.

instructions.text: Melt 2 tablespoon butter in a saucepan. Mix in the shallots and stir for 2 minutes.
Stir in the flour. Add the milk. Keep whisking until smooth.
Let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes. It should be thick by then.
Add the cheddar, salt and pepper, and egg yolks.
Keep stirring for 4 minutes.
Pour the mixture into a bowl and stir in the chives and ham.
Cover with plastic and refrigerate for half an hour.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Butter a soufflé dish.
Beat the eggs whites with a hand mixer until they are stiff.
Fold the whites into the cheese mix.
Pour the batter into the soufflé dish.
Bake for 40 minutes.

notes: Requires 30 minutes refrigeration
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Quiche, Crepes and Souffles

recipes.title: Crab Soufflé
