recipes.description: An elegant soufflé that can either be served alone as a first course or paired with a simple salad for a main meal.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease four ramekins with the butter and set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, pepper, parsley and paprika till well combined.
Gently stir in the crab and cream cheese, taking care not to break up the crab too much.
Pour the mixture into the prepared ramekins and bake until the tops are golden brown, about 40 minutes.

notes: Serve with a side salad and crusty bread for a full meal
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Quiche, Crepes and Souffles

recipes.title: French Toast Soufflé
recipes.description: A delicious, different take on French toast with a crunchy top and soft gooey middle. This is sure to become a breakfast favorite.

instructions.text: Grease a 7x11 baking dish and fill with the bread cubes. This should take up half the dish.
Mix together the maple syrup, butter and cream cheese until well combined.
Spoon this mixture evenly over the bread.
Beat together the eggs, half and half, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla and pour this mixture over the bread, making sure that all the bread is covered.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight.
The next morning, remove from the fridge and let stand for at least 20 minutes before baking. In the meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bake for an hour or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

notes: Requires overnight chilling
Serve with fruit and drizzle with maple syrup
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Quiche, Crepes and Souffles

recipes.title: Breakfast Enchilada Cheese Sauce
recipes.description: These scrumptious enchiladas are perfect for breakfast.

instructions.text: Melt the butter, then add the flour.
Stir until mixture is smooth.
Add the milk, keep whisking until the mixture is thickened.
Place pan on the counter and stir in all of the other ingredients.

notes: Use for Breakfast Enchiladas
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Sausage Twist
recipes.description: This twist can be cut into individual pieces for a yummy breakfast.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Flatten out the dough on a baking sheet.
Top the dough with the sausage, olives and cheeses.
Fold the dough over the filling and make diagonal cuts on top.
Beat the egg and brush over the dough.
Bake for 20 minutes. Dough should be a light brown.
Slice the dough into six portions.

recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Burritos
recipes.description: These are spicy! Use mild sausage for less heat.

instructions.text: Fry the sausage, pepper and jalapeno pepper for 10 minutes.
Drain the fat, but leave sausages in the skillet.
Mix the eggs and the milk. Add the mixture to the skillet.
Cook until the eggs are just cooked. Add the cream cheese and continue cooking until the cream cheese is blended. Keep the mixture warm.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet.
Divide the sausage mixture onto each tortilla. Roll up tortilla and fold to close.
Repeat with all of the tortillas.
Place the toppings in separate bowl.

notes: Toppings: Shredded cheese, Black Beans, Chopped avocado, Salsa
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Stuffed French Toast
recipes.description: French toast with a filling – yummy.

instructions.text: Blend the eggs, milk, and honey in a bowl.
Place half of the bread on the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
Top with the cream cheese, and the remaining bread.
Top the bread with the egg mixture, making sure to coat all, and chill overnight.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.
Top with butter or syrup.

notes: Requires overnight chilling
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Frittata
recipes.description: Fix this when you have a hungry crowd.

instructions.text: Fry the bacon in a skillet. When bacon is crispy, mix in the green pepper.
Stir for approximately 3 minutes.
Remove skillet from stove and drain any excess fat. Add the salt and pepper.
Place skillet back on stove and mix in the diced potatoes. Stir for approximately 2 minutes.
Add the eggs. Stir for 5 minutes. Eggs should still be soft.
Top frittata with the feta cheese.
Preheat the broiler.
Broil frittatas for 5 minutes.

recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Enchiladas
recipes.description: There's no reason not to enjoy a delicious enchilada for breakfast.

instructions.text: Crumble and fry the sausage in a skillet. Drain on a paper towel.
Use another skillet to melt the butter.
Add the scallions, eggs, salt and pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Place the mixture in a bowl and mix in the sausage and 1 cup of cheese sauce (see recipe below).
Divide the mix onto each tortilla.
Roll up the tortilla and transfer them to a buttered 9 x 13 baking dish.
Top with the rest of the cheese sauce and the Monterey Jack.
Bake for half an hour at 350 degrees.
Serve with toppings.

notes: For Cheese Sauce: 1/4 cup sweet butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 cups whole milk, 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, 1 tsp salt

Cheese Sauce Directions: Use a saucepan to melt the butter. Beat in the flour and keep whisking for a minute. Add the milk and cook over low heat for 5 minutes while continuously stirring. Mix in the cheese and salt and stir until cheese in melted.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Sausage and Cheese Breakfast Pizza
recipes.description: Pizza for breakfast - a great way to start the day!

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Brown the sausage over medium heat and drain.

Press the dough together into a greased 12-inch pizza pan to make one round crust. Spread the cooked sausage and bell pepper over the dough and then top evenly with the hash browns. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese.
Beat together the milk, eggs, salt and pepper until well combined and pour this over the top of the cheddar cheese.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Bake until the crust is browned and cheese is melted, about 25 minutes.

notes: For a healthier option, use ground turkey instead of sausage
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Muffins
recipes.description: Delicious and easy to prepare, these are great for breakfast or even lunch on the go.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Mix in the cheese. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the ham. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: The ham can be replaced with crumbled bacon
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Hash Brown Casserole
recipes.description: This casserole is super easy to prepare, great if you're having a crowd over.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a 9x9-inch oven-proof dish with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients, reserving half of the cheddar cheese.
Pour the mixture into the prepared dish and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes.

notes: Top with crushed cornflakes before baking for a lovely, crisp crust
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Apple Breakfast Bars
recipes.description: Make these nutritious bars ahead of time and store in the fridge for a quick breakfast.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 8x8-inch baking dish.
Squeeze the grated apple to remove excess moisture. Add all the ingredients to a large bowl and mix until well combined.
Press the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake until lightly browned, about 30 minutes.
Cut into bars while still warm.

notes: Tastes great crushed over yoghurt
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Tacos
recipes.description: These delicious tacos make a hearty breakfast.

instructions.text: Crumble the sausage into a nonstick pan and cook over medium heat until browned. Set aside.

Whisk the eggs, milk, salt and pepper together. Add the eggs to a lightly greased pan over medium heat. Stir and cook until the eggs are almost firm and then add in the sausage. Continue cooking until eggs are firm.
Heat the tortillas on a griddle. Sprinkle with cheese and spoon in some of the egg and sausage mix. Add salsa and cilantro to your taste.

recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Parfait
recipes.description: These delicious parfaits can be made ahead and refrigerated for a quick breakfast.

instructions.text: Mix the frozen berries together with the apple juice and vanilla extract. Set aside until the berries are thawed.

Spoon 2 tablespoons of the muesli into four small dishes or glasses. Top each layer of muesli with 2 tablespoons of yoghurt and two tablespoons of the berries. Repeat the layers until all the mix is used up.
Cover and refrigerate until needed.

notes: Any of your favorite fruit can be used instead of the frozen berries
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Quinoa
recipes.description: Try this breakfast quinoa, packed with fiber and protein, as a great alternative to your morning oatmeal.

instructions.text: Rinse the quinoa until the water runs clear. Strain well.
Heat the milk over medium heat until just warm. Add the quinoa and salt and mix well.
Lower the heat and stir in the cinnamon.
Keep cooking until all the liquid is absorbed by the quinoa, about 20 minutes.
Turn off the heat and mix in the maple syrup.
Fold in the berries, coconut and sunflower seeds and cover and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

notes: More milk can be added for a thinner consistency
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Calzone
recipes.description: A hearty breakfast that can be made ahead and frozen for the week.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Beat 8 eggs with the milk, salt and pepper. Set aside.
In a pan over medium heat cook the sausage until browned. Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.

Turn heat down to low and cook the eggs, stirring until set. Add the eggs to a bowl together with the pork sausage. Mix them together and allow to cool slightly for about 10 minutes. Then stir in the cheese.

Roll out the dough and divide into 6 rectangles. Divide the egg and sausage mix between them. Fold the dough over and seal the edges with egg wash. Press the tines of a fork all around the edges to seal.
Place calzones on a greased cookie sheet. Brush the remaining egg over the tops and poke once with a fork to create four holes.
Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes.

notes: If preferred, bacon or ham can be used instead of the sausage
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Panini Sandwich
recipes.description: A great breakfast sandwich that can easily be adapted to suit your taste.

instructions.text: Heat the butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Beat the eggs, salt, pepper and chives together and add to the pan. Stir and cook until set.
Cut the ciabatta rolls in half lengthways and divide the eggs among them. Layer with the ham, tomato and cheese.
Cook on a preheated panini maker or grill until the cheese is melted and the bread is browned.
Serve immediately.

notes: Try using Brie instead of Cheddar cheese for an interesting twist
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Blueberry Breakfast Crescents
recipes.description: Great for breakfast or dessert, these blueberry crescents are so quick to throw together yet so delicious.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Unroll the crescent roll dough and place the triangles on a baking sheet.
Mix the cream cheese and sugar together till well combined. Fold in the blueberries. Divide the mixture among the crescent rolls. Roll up the dough and seal the edges and ends.
Bake until golden brown, about 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool.

notes: For an added zip try adding some lemon zest to your cream cheese mixture
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Breakfast Bruschetta
recipes.description: A delicious way to jazz up plain, old scrambled eggs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Slice the baguette into half-inch thick slices. Place on a baking tray that has been sprayed with nonstick spray.
Brush the slices with the melted butter and sprinkle with the garlic powder.
Bake until crispy, about 5 to six minutes.
In a large bowl mix together the tomato, olive oil and basil. Set aside.
Heat the butter in a pan over medium heat. Beat the eggs, salt, pepper and chives together and add to the pan. Stir and cook until set. Add the eggs to the tomato mixture and combine well.
Distribute the egg mix among the toasted bread slices and serve immediately.

notes: Try adding your favorite cheese to your scrambled eggs
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Spinach Cheese Wraps
recipes.description: These wraps are so quick and easy to prepare. Enjoy them for breakfast or even as a quick weeknight dinner.

instructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft. Add in the spinach and cook until just starting to wilt. Remove from heat.
Divide the mix between 2 tortillas, then top with the cheese and remaining two tortillas. Season and roll up the tortillas.
Cook in a preheated sandwich press until the cheese is melted and tortilla is golden.

notes: Serve with scrambled eggs for a hearty breakfast
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Au Gratin Potato Muffins
recipes.description: Replace your breakfast hash browns with these cheesy potato muffins that are made from a few simple, everyday ingredients.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a muffin tin (8 cups) with a nonstick cooking spray.
Add a layer of potato slices to each muffin cup. Top with a layer of cheese and then scallions. Repeat until all ingredients are used up.
Season with the salt and pepper. Add two tablespoons of the cream to each muffin cup. Cover with foil.
Bake for 40 minutes, removing the foil halfway through the cooking time.
Remove from the oven and allow to sit for 4 to 5 minutes before inverting onto a plate.
Serve immediately.

notes: If desired, add half a cup of cooked chopped ham to your muffins
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Pancake and Fruit Kabobs
recipes.description: Kids will love these mini pancake and fruit skewers that are so fun to eat.

instructions.text: Sift together the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder in a large bowl. Set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the egg, butter, milk and vanilla. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well until smooth.
Heat an oiled griddle over medium high heat. Drop tablespoons full of the batter on the heated griddle. Cook until bubbles appear and most have burst, then flip over and cook the other side.
To assemble, thread a pancake onto a skewer. Alternate with strawberries, pancakes and bananas.
Drizzle with the maple syrup and serve.

notes: For a savory kabob use your favorite breakfast sausage instead of the fruit
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Bacon and Egg Cups
recipes.description: An easy all-in-one breakfast recipe; great for when you are cooking for a large group.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Fry the bacon slices for 2 to 3 minutes to par cook them. Drain on paper towels.
Line the cups of a muffin pan with the bacon slices, creating a ring around the side of each cup. Drop a teaspoon of the melted butter into each cup.
Crack one egg into each cup.
Season with the salt and pepper and sprinkle with the cheese.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the egg reaches the doneness you prefer.
Serve immediately.

notes: Sprinkle with chopped scallions and serve with toast points
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: French Toast Casserole
recipes.description: Prepare this delicious treat the night before and simply pop in the oven for a no fuss breakfast.

instructions.text: Grease a 7x11-inch baking dish and fill the bottom with the bread cubes.
Mix together the maple syrup, butter and cream cheese until well combined.
Spoon this mixture evenly over the bread.
Beat together the eggs, half and half, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla and pour this mixture over the bread, making sure that all the bread is covered.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight.
The next morning, remove from the fridge and let stand for at least 20 minutes before baking. In the meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F.
Bake for an hour or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

notes: Serve warm, drizzled with maple syrup
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Cheesy Scrambled Eggs with Herbs
recipes.description: Creamy scrambled eggs with ricotta cheese and fresh herbs.

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until well blended.
Place about 1 tablespoon unsalted butter in a frying pan and melt over medium-high heat. Swirl to coat base and sides of pan.

Adjust heat to medium-low and pour egg mixture into buttered pan. Gently stir with a fork to create a curdled, fluffy mixture and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until eggs are slightly set and cheese is just melted.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.

notes: Omit cheese and other types of herbs of your choice
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Egg in a Hole
recipes.description: A classic breakfast dish with an egg cooked in a hole cut from bread.

instructions.text: Using a cookie or biscuit cutter, cut a hole in the middle of bread slice.
Pour 1 teaspoon oil in a pan and set over medium heat. Place bread on pan.
Crack an egg in the middle of the hole. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until bread is golden brown.
Turn bread over and cook the other side until egg is set.
Transfer onto plates and top with grated cheese. Serve immediately.

notes: You can use finely chopped herbs in place of cheese. You may also use other types of bread.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Filipino-Style Omelet
recipes.description: A traditional Filipino omelet made with dried fish, tomatoes, and onions.

instructions.text: Beat eggs and salt until light. Set aside.
Sauté garlic in 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat until brown and fragrant. Add onions and stir-fry until wilted, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes and daing flakes. Continue cooking until tomatoes are soft, about 3 minutes. Remove filling from oil with a slotted spoon and transfer to a plate or bowl and set aside.
Using the same oil where vegetables were cooked, pour all of the beaten eggs and swirl pan until bottom is evenly coated. Cook for two minutes or until set.
Spoon filling over eggs and spread evenly. Fold one side over the other, being careful not to spill the filling. Cook for another minute, then transfer to a plate. Serve immediately.

notes: If dried fish or 'daing' is not available in your area, use canned tuna in brine. Make sure to drain tuna before using.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Fluffy Creamy Eggs
recipes.description: Light and fluffy eggs made with mayonnaise for extra creaminess.

instructions.text: Beat together eggs, salt and pepper until light and well-combined. Stir in mayonnaise and blend well.

Pour about 1 tablespoon canola oil in a pan and place over medium heat. Once you see a hint of smoke inside the pan, gradually pour in egg mixture. If you are using a large pan, you can pour all of the mixture at once. If you pan is small, pour only half of the egg mixture.
Swirl pan to allow remaining liquid to spread further, cutting into the coagulated portions, if necessary.
Once eggs are set, fold half of egg over the other, retaining a slightly moist interior. Remove from heat and transfer to a plate. Serve hot.

notes: Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of grated cheese into the center of egg 'cake' in the pan before folding. You may also use chopped herbs or bacon bits.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs Italiana on Toast
recipes.description: Italian-style scrambled eggs with homemade pesto on toasted baguette.

instructions.text: Beat eggs with pesto sauce, salt and pepper until frothy. Set aside.
Heat oil over medium heat and add beaten eggs. Cook while stirring with a fork or rubber spatula until curd-like in consistency.
Remove from heat and divide among toasted baguettes. Serve immediately as open-faced sandwiches.

notes: Pesto Recipe: 3 tbsp fresh basil leaves, 2 tbsp walnuts (chopped), 1/4 clove garlic (peeled), 3/4 tsp Parmesan cheese (grated), 1 tbsp olive oil. Combine basil, walnuts, garlic and Parmesan in food processor and pulse until creamy. Slowly add olive oil while pulsing. Season with salt and pepper.
Replace pesto with Cajun seasoning for a hot and spicy version
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Sweet Ham Omelet
recipes.description: A simple omelet with sweet ham and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Sauté green onions in butter in a heavy pan until soft.
Whisk together eggs and milk and pour over sautéed onions. Cook until bottom part of egg sets.
Lift egg to allow excess to run underneath. Continue cooking until nearly set.
Spread cooked ham cubes on top of egg. Sprinkle with cheese and season to taste.
Remove from heat and loosely cover pan until cheese melts.
Transfer to a large platter and cut into wedges. Serve warm.

notes: Replace sweet ham with sausage or other cold cuts you prefer. Add red pepper flakes for a spicy punch.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Overnight Egg and Sausage Bake
recipes.description: This delicious casserole can be prepared the night before and just popped in the oven for breakfast, perfect for a lazy weekend morning.

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Sauté the onion for 2 to 3 minutes then add in the sausage.
Crumble the sausage and cook until browned. Drain and set aside.
Beat the eggs, milk, pepper, garlic powder, salt and mustard together. Stir in the sausage mixture and the cheese. Gently stir in the bread cubes.
Pour the mixture into a greased 11x7-inch baking dish.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes prior to baking.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F for 45 minutes.

notes: Serve with buttered toast points
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Bacon and Egg Cupcakes
recipes.description: A full, hearty breakfast all rolled together in an easy cupcake.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
In a pan, fry the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels.
In a large bowl mix together the bacon, cheese, grated potato and scallions.
Divide the mixture evenly among the muffin cups. Layer with a slice of tomato and then crack an egg into each cup.
Season with the salt and pepper.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the egg reaches the doneness you prefer.
Serve immediately.

notes: Refrigerate leftovers and reheat in the microwave before serving
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Egg and Cheese Frittata
recipes.description: A quick and easy breakfast frittata recipe that can easily be adapted to your taste.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper, garlic powder and scallions and pour into the skillet.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Add crumbled bacon or ham to your egg mixture for an all-in-one breakfast
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Cheesy Eggs and Spinach Skillet Bake
recipes.description: An easy frittata recipe that can be served for breakfast or paired with a salad for lunch or dinner.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper and garlic powder and pour into the skillet. Layer the spinach over the egg mixture.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Feta cheese pairs really well with spinach, try using it instead of cheddar in this recipe
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: More Quick and Easy Breakfast Recipes

recipes.title: Apple Pie French Toast
recipes.description: French toast stuffed with spiced apple filling, dusted with confectioners' sugar.

instructions.text: Cook apples in water until tender, about 10 minutes.

Combine 1/4 cup of sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg and add to apples. Cook, with frequent stirring, until thickened, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add lemon juice. Stir until well-blended.
Divide apple filling into 4 portions and spread evenly on four of the bread slices. Top with remaining bread and press down slightly to seal.
Whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla and remaining sugar.
Dip sandwiches in beaten mixture until coated. Cook over medium heat on a buttered skillet until both sides are golden.
Place on individual plates and dust with confectioner's sugar. Serve immediately.

notes: Serve with whipped cream and orange juice. Replace apples with peaches or pears.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles

recipes.title: Basic Flapjacks
recipes.description: Classic fluffy flapjacks perfect for any breakfast.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
Whisk together milk, eggs, butter, and vanilla extract. Gradually add sifted ingredients to milk mixture and whisk until just combined.

Brush a non-stick pan with vegetable oil or melted butter and place over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup batter into pan and cook cake until bubbles appear on the surface and underside is slightly browned.
Turn flapjack over to cook the other side. Transfer to a heat proof plate and keep warm in a low-heat oven. Repeat with remaining batter.

notes: Serve flapjacks with your choice of syrup and fruits
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles

recipes.title: Buttermilk Breakfast Waffles
recipes.description: Light and fluffy buttermilk waffles with beaten egg whites.

instructions.text: Pre-heat waffle maker as per manufacturer's directions and brush with canola oil or unsalted butter.
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl until well blended.

Whisk together butter milk, sour cream, melted butter and egg yolks in another bowl until combined. Gradually add dry ingredients and mix until moist but not thin. To make sure you did not over mix batter, there should still be lumps.
In another bowl, beat egg whites over high heat until still but not dry. Gently fold into batter until no white streaks are visible.
Spoon batter into preheated waffle maker. The amount of batter depends on the size of your waffle maker, however leave about an inch border on all sides, spreading the batter if needed.
Close the lid and cook until waffles for about 3 to 5 minutes, or until steam stops. Remove waffles and place in a heat-proof plate and into a warm oven. Repeat with remaining batter.

notes: You can replace buttermilk with whole milk or cream. Top with your choice of syrup or fruit.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles

recipes.title: Creamy Cheesy French Toasts
recipes.description: French toast sandwiches filled with cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread. Place a slice of cheese on one piece of bread over the buttered side.
Top with another piece of bread, buttered side-down and press slightly to seal sandwich. Repeat with remaining bread and cheese. Set aside.
Beat egg until light in color and combine with milk, sugar and vanilla. Stir until well blended.
Melt about 1 tablespoon butter in a pan over medium low heat. Swirl to coat bottom of pan evenly.
Dip a sandwich in the egg-milk mixture until some of the liquid is absorbed. Place sandwich on buttered pan. Cook until golden-brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Turn sandwich over and continue cooking until the other side is done, about 2 minutes. Repeat with remaining sandwiches, adding butter as needed to prevent toasts from sticking onto the pan.
Drain on paper towels, if needed and cut each sandwich in half diagonally to make 12 sandwiches. Serve hot or warm.

notes: You can replace milk with light cream and add bacon or ham slices with cheese as filling. Substitute cheese sauce with cream cheese or fruit jam.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles

recipes.title: Traditional Hotcakes
recipes.description: Simple cornmeal hotcakes fried in bacon grease.

instructions.text: Place water in a kettle and allow to boil. When water is on a full rolling boil, remove from heat and measure one cupful.
Combine cornmeal and salt in a bowl. Gradually add boiling water to cornmeal and stir until you get a thick, pasty mash.
Pour about 4 tablespoons bacon grease or melted butter into a heavy skillet and place over medium heat.
Shape about 1/4 cup of mash into a patty, fry one side until brown and crispy. Flip cake to cook the other side. Repeat with remaining mixture.

notes: Serve with maple syrup or molasses for breakfast or snacks, or as side dish to mess o' greens
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: French Toast, Pancakes and Waffles

recipes.title: Apple-Bacon-Cheese Muffin Sandwiches
recipes.description: Open-faced toasted bread topped with cheese sauce, Canadian bacon, apple and melted cheese.

instructions.text: Pre-heat oven to 350°F.
Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet. Spread about 1/2 tablespoon cheese sauce on each of the bread slices.
Top with bacon, apple slices and cheese. Bake until cheese melts, about 5 to 7 minutes. Serve right away.

notes: You can use a firmer type of bread like ciabatta and use orange segments instead of apples. Substitute cheese sauce with cream cheese or fruit jam.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Basic Hash Browns
recipes.description: Simple pan-fried potato patties.

instructions.text: Combine grated potatoes, onion, salt and pepper. Mix well.
Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a pan set over medium heat.
Form about 1/4 cup potato mixture into an oblong shaped patty and fry until golden, about 5 minutes.
Turn patty over and cook until done, about 3 minutes. Repeat with remaining grated potatoes.

notes: Serve with savory meat cuts or stir-fried vegetables
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Breakfast Churros
recipes.description: Homemade churros perfect for breakfast, served with sugar or honey.

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder in a large bowl. Set aside.
In a medium-sized pan, combine water, canola oil, salt and sugar. Place over medium heat and allow to boil.
Remove from heat and gradually add to dry ingredients, stirring as you go. Batter should be sticky and smooth, almost like a dough. Spoon into a pastry bag and set aside.
Pour enough vegetable oil in a deep pan to fry churros. Oil should be about 2 inches deep.
When oil is about 350°F, carefully squeeze churros dough into hot oil, creating an elongated shape. Deep-fry until golden brown.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Keep warm in an oven. Repeat with remaining dough.
Cut pastries into desired lengths and sprinkle with granulated sugar or drizzle with honey.

notes: Serve with black coffee or hot chocolate. You can pair this with the 'Mexican Breakfast Choco Drink' recipe.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Breakfast Oat Bruleé
recipes.description: Creamy oatmeal topped with caramelized brown sugar, bananas, and yogurt.

instructions.text: Preheat grill to 400°F.
Boil water and salt over medium heat in a deep pan or pot.
Gradually add oats while stirring to prevent lumps. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking, about 3 to 5 minutes until oats are soft and mixture is thickened.
Stir in cream, cinnamon, 2 tablespoons brown sugar and nuts.
Remove from heat and spoon oat mixture into 8 ramekins. Arrange banana slices over oat mixture.
Top each ramekin with 1/4 cup yogurt and sprinkle with remaining sugar.
Arrange ramekins on a cookie sheet and place under the pre-heated grill for 1 to 2 minutes or until sugar caramelizes. Serve hot or warm.

notes: Serve with fresh fruit as breakfast. You may replace yogurt with whipped cream. Mango can be used as a substitute for bananas.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Breakfast Sandwich with Summer Fruits
recipes.description: Toasted ciabatta with cream cheese, mango, and cherries topped with cinnamon sugar.

instructions.text: Slice ciabatta lengthwise and toast until crisp.
Spread cream cheese on bottom portions of bread and top with mashed mango pulp.
Arrange cherries over mango and dust with sugar-cinnamon mix.
Cover with top portion and dust with more sugar-cinnamon mix. Serve immediately.

notes: You may use other summer fruit or berries in season. Grilled fruit like pineapples and peaches are also good substitutes.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Cheesy Mushroom and Egg Sandwiches
recipes.description: Toasted wheat bread sandwiches filled with sautéed mushrooms, cheese sauce, and hard-boiled eggs.

instructions.text: Heat oil in a pan and sauté spring onions and mushrooms over high heat until tender and golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
Adjust heat to medium and stir in cheese sauce. Heat until very hot.
Remove from heat and stir in chopped eggs.
Divide filling into two portions and sandwich between two slices of toasted wheat bread. Serve immediately.

notes: Replace egg with chopped spiced ham and add 1 tablespoon chopped jalapeños to filling mix to add zing.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Porridge
recipes.description: Simple oatmeal topped with chocolate chips and honey.

instructions.text: Cook oats and milk over medium-low heat until thick, about 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Divide into 2 bowls and sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Drizzle with honey. Sprinkle with cinnamon, if desired. Serve hot.

notes: Top porridge with slices of fruit. Serve with orange juice.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Creamy Banana Cereal
recipes.description: Light and fluffy banana cream topped with muesli.

instructions.text: Toss banana slices with lemon juice.
Beat together yogurt and cream cheese. Add banana slices and mix well.
Beat egg whites until stiff and gently fold into banana-cream mixture.
Spoon mixture into individual glasses or bowls and top with cereal or muesli.
Serve immediately or chill before serving.

notes: Replace bananas with other types of fruit in season. Yogurt can be replaced with cream. Add sugar or honey to taste.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: English Crumpets
recipes.description: Classic English crumpets cooked in ring molds.

instructions.text: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Set aside.
Whisk together eggs, milk, butter and vanilla in a medium-sized bowl. Gradually add to dry ingredients, whisking until just combined. Do not over mix.
Brush 2 to 3 biscuit ramekins with butter or oil.
Brush a non-stick pan with butter or vegetable oil. Place over low heat.
Once pan starts to smoke, place ramekins into pan and spoon batter into ramekin. Do not let batter overflow. Number of ramekins would depend on the size of your pan.

Cook crumpets until bubbly on top. Remove ramekins and turn cakes over. You may also want to leave crumpets as they are, browning the base thoroughly while tops remain light in color and riddled with holes.
Remove from heat and keep warm on a plate in a low-heat oven. Repeat with remaining batter, brushing cooking pan and ramekins with more butter or oil as needed.
Serve warm with butter and jam or eggs.

notes: Spread one crumpet with butter then top with jam and fruit slices. Cover with another cake to make a sandwich.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Fruity Breakfast Sandwich
recipes.description: French toast towers topped with caramelized bananas and raspberries.

instructions.text: Spread pineapple marmalade on one side of each bread slice. Place one slice on a plate, marmalade-side up.
Top with remaining pieces. The last piece should have the marmalade side face-down. Cut diagonally to make 4 'towers.' Set aside.
Beat together egg and milk until light.
Melt butter in a saucepan. Dip 'tower' sandwiches in egg-milk mixture, coating the surface evenly. Fry until golden on all sides. Transfer onto 2 to 4 plates.
Add sugar to remaining butter in pan and stir until melted. Add banana slices and cook until caramel-like and banana slices are coated.
Spoon over fried bread with raspberries.

notes: Serve with whipped cream or ice cream as snack.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Fruity Breakfast Sundae
recipes.description: Layered parfait with mango yogurt, fresh fruits, and cornflakes.

instructions.text: Divide ingredients into 4 portions each.
In 2 parfait glasses or bowls, alternately layer yogurt, blueberries, peaches, mangoes and cornflakes, ending layers with cornflakes.
Serve immediately.

notes: Use other fruits in season. Replace mango yogurt with your own preferred flavor.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Fruity Latvian Breakfast
recipes.description: A healthy breakfast bowl with mashed banana, grapefruit, and wheat germ.

instructions.text: Mash bananas with grapefruit juice until pasty.
Add grapefruit pulp and remaining juice. Stir in wheat germ and linseeds.
Transfer to individual bowls and top with boiling water until desired consistency is reached.
Sweeten with honey to taste. Serve right away.

notes: Replace grapefruit with pineapple (and pineapple juice), or apples (and apple cider). If using apples, blanch apples, peel skin with a vegetable peeler, remove core and chop coarsely. Soak in water until needed to prevent discoloration. Use apple cider instead of grapefruit juice.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Grilled Fruity Croissant Sandwich
recipes.description: Warm croissants filled with cream cheese, berries, and melted chocolate.

instructions.text: Slice each croissant lengthwise and spread about 1 tablespoon cream cheese on the base of each.
Arrange strawberry halves over cream cheese and top with blueberries.
Sprinkle with grated chocolate. Sprinkle top portions of croissants with grated chocolate.
Grill fruit-filled bases and chocolate-sprinkled tops until chocolate is melted.
Remove from heat and cover fruit-filled portions with top portions.
Dust with confectioner's sugar mixed with cinnamon. Serve immediately.

notes: Replace cream cheese with apricot jam and substitute berries with orange segments or thinly sliced peaches or other fruit in season.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Open-Faced Sandwiches
recipes.description: Open-faced ciabatta sandwiches topped with scrambled eggs, ham, bacon, tomatoes, and melted cheese.

instructions.text: Melt butter in a non-stick pan. Combine eggs, chives, water, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring gently, until eggs are slightly set.
Spread filling over each half of the ciabatta.
Top with slices of ham, 3 strips of bacon, tomatoes and grated cheese.
Arrange on a baking sheet and broil until cheese melts, about 2 to 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

notes: Use white bread with crusts trimmed, if ciabatta is not available.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Hungarian Sausage Breakfast Wraps
recipes.description: Tortilla wraps filled with Hungarian sausage, scrambled eggs, and cheese.

instructions.text: Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Stir-fry sausage until slightly browned, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Add onion and sauté for 2 minutes until soft. Add green pepper and stir fry for 1 minute.
Pour in beaten eggs and season to taste. Gently stir until egg is set. Remove from heat.
Spread sour cream on warmed tortillas. Spoon sausage-egg filling over sour cream and sprinkle with grated cheese.
Fold lower portion and sides of tortilla over filling and roll. Serve immediately.

notes: Substitute Hungarian sausage with your own choice of meat or cold cuts. Replace sour cream with mayonnaise. Add cayenne pepper to filling mixture for a spicy version.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Pita Breakfast Pizza
recipes.description: Quick tortilla pizzas topped with spaghetti sauce, bacon, pineapple, and mozzarella.

instructions.text: Spread spaghetti sauce over each tortilla.
Divide bacon and pineapple equally among the tortillas.
Sprinkle with mozzarella and bake in a pre-heated 375°F oven for 10 minutes or until cheese melts.
Serve hot or warm.

notes: Replace spaghetti sauce with sour cream and top with fruit and grated cheddar cheese.
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Book Four: Other Recipes

recipes.title: Salmon and Rocket Sandwich
recipes.description: A delicious sandwich with smoked salmon, crispy bacon, cream cheese and fresh rocket on toasted ciabatta.

instructions.text: Slice ciabatta lengthwise and toast until crisp.
Arrange smoked salmon slices on the base of bread and spread with cream cheese.
Top with bacon.
Season with freshly ground black or cayenne pepper.
Arrange rocket leaves over bacon and cover with other half of ciabatta.
Cut crosswise and serve immediately.

notes: Replace salmon and bacon with your choice of cold cuts, replace rocket with other salad greens.

recipes.title: Spicy Breakfast Migas
recipes.description: A Tex-Mex breakfast dish with crispy tortilla strips, scrambled eggs, peppers, and cheese.

instructions.text: Fry flour tortillas in oil over high heat until golden and crispy, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drain on paper towels and cut into cubes. If tortillas crumble, that's fine. Save the crumbs as well. Set aside.
Whisk together eggs and half and half with seasonings as desired. Set aside.
Heat canola oil in large pan over medium heat. Sauté red onion until wilted, about 3 minutes.
Add red and green peppers and continue sautéing. Add tomatoes, and stir until tender but not soggy. Add jalapeño and stir a little.
Reduce heat to low and gradually pour in beaten egg mixture. Gently fold eggs into sautéed vegetables until set but not dry.
Sprinkle with cheese and cilantro and cook for another minute. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve warm.

notes: Omit jalapeño, if desired. Use other herbs you prefer.

recipes.title: Southern Grits
recipes.description: Classic Southern cheese grits with butter and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Pour water and salt in a pan. Place over medium heat and boil.
Gradually stir in grits and cook for 1 minute with constant stirring.
Reduce heat to low when mixture starts to boil. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Stir in pepper, butter and cheese until melted.

notes: Grits can be served with bacon or sausage, eggs, biscuits or toast.

recipes.title: Hash Brown Frittata
recipes.description: A filling frittata recipe that can be made for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Add the hash brown potatoes to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper and garlic powder and pour into the skillet over the hash browns. Layer the spinach over the egg mixture.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Serve with a green salad for a light lunch or dinner.

recipes.title: Bacon and Tomato Frittata
recipes.description: A satisfying, hearty breakfast that is quick and easy to prepare.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper and garlic powder. Mix in the bacon and scallions and pour into the skillet. Layer with the tomato slices.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Sprinkle with chopped parsley to serve.

recipes.title: Broccoli and Cheese Frittata
recipes.description: An easy to follow frittata recipe that is sure to be a crowd pleaser.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler.
Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli and cook for 2 minutes.
Beat the eggs with the salt, pepper, garlic powder and scallions and pour over the broccoli.
Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top and place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the eggs are lightly browned.
Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

notes: Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat in the microwave before serving.

recipes.title: Cherry Chocolate Scones
recipes.description: These scones make a tasty breakfast treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.
Sift the flour and salt together in a large bowl. Rub in the butter. Mix in the chocolate and cherries.
Add the sugar, then milk and egg and combine to get a soft dough.
Knead the dough briefly on a lightly floured surface then roll out into a 1/2-inch thick round.
Divide and cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: If preferred, white chocolate chips can be used instead of the semi-sweet chocolate.

recipes.title: Apricot Scones
recipes.description: A delicious treat to go with your morning coffee.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.
Sift the flour, cinnamon and salt together in a large bowl. Rub in the butter. Mix in the apricots.
Add the sugar, then milk and egg and combine to get a soft dough.
Knead the dough briefly on a lightly floured surface then roll out into a 1/2-inch thick round.
Divide and cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to three days.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Oat Scones
recipes.description: A delicious lightly spiced scone. Serve for breakfast or as a teatime treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a baking sheet and set aside.
Mix the flours, oats, cinnamon and salt together in a large bowl. Rub in the butter.
Add the sugar, then milk, egg and maple syrup and combine to get a soft dough.
Knead the dough briefly on a lightly floured surface then roll out into a 1/2-inch thick round.
Divide and cut into 8 wedges, and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Scones
recipes.description: Pumpkin and chocolate pair beautifully together in this delicious scone.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Whisk together the flour, sugar, spices, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Blend the butter into the flour mixture slowly, using two knives or working with your fingers, until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Set aside.
In another bowl, combine the buttermilk, pumpkin puree, chocolate chips and vanilla and mix well. Add this to the dry ingredients and mix till dough is formed.
On a floured surface, gently knead the dough five or six times and pat into a circle that is about one and a half inches thick and seven inches wide.
Cut this circle into quarters, and then each quarter in half so you have eight scones. Beat the egg and milk together and brush over the tops of the scones.
Bake for 15 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
Transfer to a wire rack and cool.

notes: Drizzle with chocolate syrup before serving.

recipes.title: Apple Cheddar Muffins
recipes.description: Cheddar and apple go well together in this tasty breakfast muffin.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the apple and cheese. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm with apple butter.

recipes.title: Banana Cinnamon Muffins
recipes.description: Delicious and moist to the last bite, these muffins will disappear quickly.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, banana and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm, drizzled with honey.

recipes.title: Raisin Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Delicious breakfast muffins that are a great source of fiber.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, wheat bran, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Mix in the raisins. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm with butter.

recipes.title: Raspberry Cheesecake Poppy Seed Muffins
recipes.description: Cream cheese and tart raspberries are a great match in these delicious, moist muffins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, cream cheese, poppy seeds and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the raspberries.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Use half a cup of chopped walnuts instead of poppy seeds if desired.

recipes.title: Ham and Spinach Pie
recipes.description: With the exception of the phyllo dough, which I always have on hand, this ham and spinach pie recipe is made entirely from Easter dinner leftovers. One of my neighbors traded me four freshly caught trout for a slice!

ingredients.item: 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
2 cups finely chopped fully cooked ham
Optional: Salt and pepper to taste

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until transparent, 6-8 minutes. Add mushrooms and garlic; cook and stir until mushrooms are browned, about 6 minutes longer. Add spinach; cook until heated through.

In a microwave, melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter; stir until smooth. Place 1 sheet of phyllo dough on a work surface; brush with butter. Layer with 3 additional phyllo sheets, brushing each layer. Transfer to a lightly greased 11x7-in. baking dish, letting ends extend up sides. (Keep remaining phyllo covered with a damp towel to prevent it from drying out.)

Layer dish with ham, cheese and spinach mixture; pour eggs over filling. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with remaining 2 sheets phyllo dough. Fold dough ends over filling; pinch edges to seal. Brush with remaining butter. Cut slits in the top. Bake until browned, 40-45 minutes. Cool 20 minutes before cutting.

recipes.title: Muffin Tin Eggs
recipes.description: Muffin tin eggs are miniature baked omelets

ingredients.item: 1 jar (4 ounces) sliced mushrooms, finely chopped
3 ounces sliced deli ham, finely chopped

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, salt, pepper and garlic powder until the eggs are beaten and the mixture is smooth. Stir in the mushrooms, green chiles, ham, onion and shredded cheese. Editor's Tip: Drain the mushrooms before mixing them with the eggs, but you can add the entire can of green chiles—the peppers and their liquid.

Generously grease two standard muffin tins. Fill each muffin cup with roughly 1/4 cup egg mixture—you should have enough to fill all 24 muffin cups. Editor's Tip: Make sure to grease the bottom and sides of each muffin cup to prevent sticking. A pastry brush is the perfect tool to ensure every nook and cranny is well-greased.

Bake the scrambled eggs in oven in muffin pans until the eggs are set, 18 to 20 minutes, rotating the muffin tins halfway through. Let the egg cups stand for 10 minutes before removing them from the pans. If desired, serve with pico de gallo. Editor's Tip: Insert a toothpick or paring knife into the center of an egg cup. They're finished when the tool comes out clean and no liquid egg seeps out.

recipes.title: Portobello Mushrooms Florentine
recipes.description: A fun and surprisingly hearty breakfast dish packed with flavor and richness.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup crumbled goat cheese or feta cheese

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°. Spritz mushrooms with cooking spray; place in a 15x10x1-in. pan, stem side up. Sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper. Bake, uncovered, until tender, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat; saute onion until tender. Stir in spinach until wilted.
Whisk together eggs and salt; add to skillet. Cook and stir until eggs are thickened and no liquid egg remains; spoon onto mushrooms. Sprinkle with cheese and, if desired, basil.

recipes.title: Yogurt & Honey Fruit Cups
recipes.description: A tasty combo of fresh fruit and creamy orange-kissed yogurt, this is guaranteed to disappear fast from your breakfast table.

ingredients.item: 4-1/2 cups cut-up fresh fruit (pears, apples, bananas, grapes, etc.)
3/4 cup mandarin orange, vanilla or lemon yogurt

instructions.text: Divide fruit among 6 individual serving bowls. Combine the yogurt, honey, orange zest and extract; spoon over the fruit.

recipes.title: Yogurt Pancakes
recipes.description: Our yogurt pancakes have a special ingredient that makes them extra fluffy. That's right; it's the yogurt, and it reacts with other ingredients to create pancakes that are unusually light and airy, just the way you like them.

ingredients.item: 2 large eggs, room temperature, lightly beaten
Optional: Semisweet chocolate chips, dried cranberries, sliced ripe bananas and coarsely chopped pecans

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and baking soda.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs, yogurt and water. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until the dry ingredients are just moistened.

Pour the batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a hot griddle coated with cooking spray, spacing each pancake a couple inches away from the others. Sprinkle in any of the optional ingredients, if desired. Flip the pancakes when bubbles form on top and the edges look firm, then cook them until the second side is golden brown. Editor’s Tip: Another way to tell the pancakes are ready is by gently touching them in the center with a spatula. They'll spring back into place when they're ready.

recipes.title: Egg Chops
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Chop the eggs very fine, mix them with the ham; add the parsley, onion juice and pepper. Rub the butter and flour together and add the milk. Stir until you have a smooth, thick sauce, then add the salt; mix this with the other ingredients and turn it out to cool. When cold form into a chop about the size of an ordinary mutton chop. Dip first in egg beaten with a tablespoonful of water, then cover carefully with bread crumbs and fry in deep hot fat. Serve with either tomato or brown sauce.

recipes.title: Eggs Scrambled With Fresh Tomatoes
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Peel the tomatoes, cut them into halves and squeeze out the seeds. Cut the tomatoes into small bits, put them into a saucepan with the salt, pepper and butter; when these are hot add the eggs, beaten until well mixed, stir until the eggs are "set," turn into a heated dish, garnish with toast and send to the table.

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs With Asparagus Tips
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Beat the eggs, add the salt, pepper and butter. Put them into a saucepan, add at once the asparagus tips and stir with a fork until the mixture is "set."

recipes.title: Omelet With Potatoes
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Beat the eggs, without separating, until thoroughly mixed; add them gradually to the mashed potato, beating all the while; add the salt and pepper. Put the butter into a good-sized saute or omelet pan; when hot, turn the ingredients into the pan, and smooth it down with a pallet knife. Let this cook slowly until nicely browned; fold it over as you would a plain omelet, and turn onto a heated dish. The parsley may be sprinkled over the top, or added to the mixture.

recipes.title: Omelet A La Duchesse
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

ingredients.item: ful of vanilla or orange flower water

instructions.text: This is a sweet baked omelet, and is served the same as one would serve an omelet souffle.

Put the sugar, water, cinnamon and lemon rind over the fire, boil until it spins a thread and stand aside to cool. Separate the eggs; beat the yolks until creamy, and add the cream, then the strained syrup. Add the vanilla, and when cool fold in the well-beaten whites. Turn at once into a shallow silver or granite dish, dust thickly with powdered sugar and bake in a quick oven until brown.

recipes.title: Egg Noodles
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Add salt to the eggs and work in enough flour to make a stiff dough. Knead thoroughly, divide into 2 portions and roll each out as thin as possible, on a floured board. Cover with cloth and let stand until partly dry. Roll up the dough and cut into ¼ inch strips. Spread out on paper to dry a little longer.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Reine
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Use ordinary shirring dishes for the eggs; butter them, break into each one egg, stand these in a pan of boiling water and in the oven until they are "set." Rub the butter and flour together, add the milk, stir until boiling, add the salt, pepper, chopped chicken and mushrooms, and put one tablespoonful of this on top of each egg and send at once to the table. This is also nice if you put a tablespoonful of the mixture in the bottom of the dish, break the egg into it, and then at serving time put another tablespoonful over the top.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Paysanne
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Add the onion and the garlic, mashed, to the cream; pour it in the bottom of a baking dish, break on top the eggs, dust with salt and pepper, stand the baking dish in a pan of water and cook in the oven until the eggs are "set." Serve in the dish in which they are cooked.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Trinidad
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Split the kidneys, cut out the tubes; scald them, drain, and cut them into thin slices. Put the butter into a saucepan, add the kidneys, toss until the kidneys are cooked, then add the flour, stock, kitchen bouquet, salt and pepper; stir until boiling. Grease a shallow granite or silver platter, break into it the eggs, sprinkle over the bread crumbs and stand them in the oven until the eggs are "set," then pour over the sauce, arrange the kidneys around the edge of the dish and send at once to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs Rossini
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Put the stock in a saucepan and boil rapidly until reduced one-half, add a drop or two of browning. Throw the chicken livers into boiling water and let them simmer gently for ten minutes; drain. Slice the mushrooms and put them, with the livers, into the stock; let them stand until you have cooked the eggs. Put a tablespoonful of butter in the bottom of a shallow platter; when melted break in the eggs, stand them in the oven until "set," garnish with the livers and mushrooms and pour over the sauce.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Valencienne
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Rub the butter and flour together, add the strained tomato, stir until boiling, add the mushrooms, sliced, salt, paprika, nutmeg and pepper. Take a granite or silver platter, put in two tablespoonfuls of butter extra, let the butter melt and heat; break into this the eggs, being very careful not to break the yolks. Let the eggs cook in the oven until "set." Then put around the edge of the dish as a garnish the boiled rice, pour over the eggs the tomato sauce, dust the top with the Parmesan cheese and send at once to the table.

recipes.title: Fillets Of Eggs
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Beat the eggs with the stock, add the salt and pepper. Turn them into a buttered square pan, stand this in another of boiling water, and cook in the oven until the eggs are thoroughly "set." Cut the preparation into thin fillets or slices, dip in either a thin batter made from one egg, a half cupful of milk and flour to thicken, or they may be dipped in beaten egg, rolled in bread crumbs and fried in deep hot fat. Arrange the fillets in a platter on a napkin, one overlapping the other; garnish with parsley and send to the table with a boat of tomato or white sauce.

recipes.title: Eggs En Panade
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Trim the crusts from the bread. Beat the eggs until well mixed, but not light, then add the milk or cream, salt and pepper. Put the oil in a shallow frying pan, dip the slices of bread in the beaten egg and drop them into the hot oil; when brown on one side, turn and brown the other. Dish on a hot platter, dust with the chopped parsley and send at once to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Bonne Femme
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Separate the whites and yolks of the eggs. Put the butter into a saucepan, add the onions, cut into very thin slices; shake until the onions are soft, but not brown, then dust over the flour, mix, and add the milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Stir carefully until this reaches boiling point, then stand it on the back part of the stove where it will keep hot for at least ten minutes. Beat the yolks of the eggs until very creamy, then stir them into the sauce, take from the fire, and fold in the well-beaten whites of the eggs. Turn into a baking dish or casserole and bake in a hot oven fifteen minutes; serve at once.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Windsor
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Rub the butter and flour together and add the stock; stir until boiling, and add the salt and pepper. Toast the bread. Poach the eggs, put them on the toast, pour over carefully the sauce, heap the chopped vegetables, mixed, in the center of each egg and send to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Finnois
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Rub the butter and flour together, add the tomatoes, and the peppers, chopped very fine. Stir until this reaches boiling point, and stand it over hot water. Poach the eggs in deep water. Toast six rounds of bread; arrange the toast on a platter, put one egg on each slice, pour around the tomato sauce, dust thickly with the chives and send to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Gretna
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Cut the celery into inch lengths, wash thoroughly, cover with boiling water and simmer gently thirty minutes until the celery is tender; drain, saving the water in which the celery was cooked for another purpose. Rub the butter and flour together, add the milk, salt and pepper; when boiling add the celery; stand this over hot water while you poach the eggs and toast six squares of bread. Butter the toast, put on each slice one egg; put these around the edge of a large platter, turn the celery into the middle of the dish and send at once to the table. To increase the beauty of this dish, and to give it a greater food value, you may garnish between the toast and celery with carefully boiled rice; this then makes an exceedingly nice supper dish.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Regence
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

ingredients.item: ful of chopped cold cooked ham

instructions.text: Stand the ham over hot water until thoroughly heated. Rub the butter and flour together, add the stock, stir until boiling, add the mushrooms, sliced, the salt, pepper and the onion; stand this over hot water while you poach the eggs. Dish the eggs, cover them with the sauce, strained, and cover with the chopped ham. Garnish the dish with mashed potatoes or boiled rice, and send at once to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Livingstone
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Toast the bread, butter it and put on top of each slice of toast a slice of pate de foie gras; put this on a heated dish, stand it at the mouth of the oven door while you poach the eggs. Put into a saucepan all the other ingredients, bring to a boil, put one poached egg on each slice of pate de foie gras; baste with the sauce and send at once to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs Mornay
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Rub the butter and flour together, add the milk, stir until boiling, add the salt and paprika, and if you have it, a teaspoonful of soy; pour half of this sauce in a shallow granite platter or baking dish. Poach the eggs, drain them carefully, and put them over the top of the sauce, cover with the remaining sauce, dust with Parmesan cheese and run in the oven a moment to brown.

recipes.title: Eggs Zanzibar
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Cut the egg plant into slices, season it with salt and pepper, dip in egg and bread crumbs and fry carefully in deep hot fat; put this on brown paper in the oven to dry. Broil the ham, cut it into squares sufficiently small to go neatly on top of each slice of egg plant. Poach the eggs, and heat the other ingredients for the sauce. Dish the egg plant on a platter, put on the ham, and on each piece of ham an egg; baste with sauce and send to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs Monte Bello
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Put about two quarts of water into a small deep saucepan; when boiling very hard drop in, one at a time, the eggs. In dropping them in, the white will fold over the yolk and make the eggs round. Push them to the back of the stove to stand for two minutes. Lift them with a skimmer, dip them in an egg beaten with a tablespoonful of water, dust them with bread crumbs and fry them in deep hot fat. You cannot use a frying basket. Just drop them in the fat, and as they are browned lift them out onto soft paper to drain. Rub the butter and flour together, add the tomato and seasoning; when boiling dish the eggs on a heated platter, pour around tomato sauce and send to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Bourbon
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Put the stock in a small saucepan, poach the eggs in it, two at a time; lift them carefully and lay them on a hot granite or silver dish. When all are poached, dust over the cheese and stand them in the hot oven for just a moment until the cheese is melted. In the meantime boil the stock until it is reduced one-half, add the butter, baste it over the eggs and send to the table. This dish may be garnished with triangular pieces of toast.

recipes.title: Eggs Bernaise
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Put the stock, yolks of eggs and olive oil into a saucepan, stir over hot water until you have a thick, smooth sauce like mayonnaise; take from the fire, and when slightly cool stir in the tarragon vinegar and parsley. Rub the butter and flour together, add the tomato, and when boiling add a palatable seasoning of salt and pepper. Toast six halves of English muffins or squares of bread. Heat a platter, butter the toast, put it on the hot platter, and poach the eggs. Put one poached egg on each slice of toast, fill the bottom of the dish with tomato sauce and put a tablespoonful of Bernaise sauce on top of each egg. These may be garnished with a little chopped truffle, or a little chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Bennett
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

ingredients.item: ful of finely chopped chives or onion

instructions.text: Cut the eggs into halves lengthwise; remove the yolks, rub them with half the butter, salt, onion and anchovy paste. Fill these back into the whites. Cover the bottom of a baking dish with ordinary white sauce, stand in the eggs, put over the bread crumbs, baste them with the remaining butter, melted, and stand in the oven long enough to brown.

recipes.title: Scalloped Eggs
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

ingredients.item: ful of finely chopped cold cooked chicken or fish

instructions.text: Chop the eggs rather fine. Rub the butter and flour together, add the milk, stir until boiling, add the salt and pepper. Put a layer of eggs in the bottom of a casserole, or baking dish, then a layer of the fish or chicken, then a little white sauce, and so continue until the ingredients are used. Dust the top thickly with bread crumbs and bake in a moderate oven until nicely browned.

recipes.title: Japanese Hard Eggs
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

ingredients.prep_note: if you have it, and a

instructions.text: Put the eggs into a saucepan of cold water, bring to boiling point, and simmer gently twenty minutes. Wash the rice through several cold waters, sprinkle it into a kettle of boiling water and boil it for thirty minutes. Remove the shells, break the eggs while they are hot, cut them into halves crosswise. Make the cream sauce, and add the onion juice. When the rice is done, drain, sprinkle it in the center of a large platter, press the halves of the eggs down into it, and pour over the cream sauce. Garnish with the chopped parsley. This takes the place of both meat and starchy vegetables for either luncheon or supper.

recipes.title: Eggs En Marinade
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Hard-boil the eggs; plunge them into cold water and remove the shells. Stick the cloves into the eggs. Pare the beets, cut them into blocks and boil them in about a pint of water. To this water add the vinegar, bring it to boiling point, add salt, pepper and the celery and mustard seed. Put the eggs into a glass jar and pour over the boiling vinegar; put on the tops and stand them aside for three weeks. A tablespoonful of grated horseradish or a half cupful of nasturtium seeds will improve the flavor and prevent mold.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Polonaise
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Hard-boil four of the eggs; when done remove the shells, cut the eggs into halves lengthwise and take out the yolks, without breaking the whites. Press the yolks through a sieve into a bowl, and add the raw yolks of the remaining two eggs, with the parsley, salt and pepper. Beat the white of the raw eggs until light, not stiff, then work them into the yolk mixture. Cover the bottom of a shallow baking pan with part of this mixture, then fill the spaces in the whites with some of the remaining mixture. Put the whites of the eggs together, making them look like whole eggs. Arrange these in the center of the dish. If you have any of the yolk mixture left, put it around in a sort of a border. Pour over a little melted butter, dust thickly with soft bread crumbs and bake in a quick oven until slightly brown. Serve plain or with cream sauce.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Hyde
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Hard-boil the eggs, and when done remove the shells and cut the eggs into halves lengthwise, keeping the whites whole. Remove the yolks, press them through a sieve, add to them the cream, half the salt and a dash of cayenne. Mix thoroughly and fill into the whites and arrange them neatly on a granite or silver platter. Put the butter into a saucepan, add the onion and flour, then the stock or cocoanut milk, and the mushrooms; stir, until it boils, add the remaining salt and pepper; take from the fire and add the parsley. Pour this over the eggs on the platter, dust thickly with bread crumbs, run into a quick oven until brown.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Vinaigrette
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Hard-boil the eggs, throw them into cold water; remove the shells and cut them into slices lengthwise. Wash and dry the lettuce, arrange it on a small meat platter, put over the top slices of hard-boiled eggs, letting one slice overlap the other. Fill the center of the dish with sliced, peeled tomatoes. Put a half teaspoonful of salt in a soup plate, add a saltspoonful of pepper and the oil; put in a piece of ice and stir until the salt is dissolved. Remove the ice, add all the other ingredients but the parsley, mix thoroughly, pour this over the eggs, dust with parsley and serve as a supper dish.

recipes.title: Eggs A La Russe
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Hard-boil the eggs, remove the shells, cut them into halves lengthwise; take out the yolks without breaking the whites, and press them through a sieve, then add the caviar, onion juice and pepper. Heap these back into the whites. Boil the stock until reduced one-half, baste the eggs carefully, run them into the oven until hot, pour over the remaining hot stock and send to the table.

recipes.title: Eggs Lyonnaise
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe

instructions.text: Hard-boil the eggs, remove the shells, throw them in cold water. Cut the onion into thin slices; put it, with the butter, into a saucepan, shake until the onion is tender, then add the flour, milk and seasoning; stir until boiling. At serving time cut the eggs into slices crosswise, put them in a shallow baking dish, cover with cream sauce and run in the oven just a moment until they are very hot.

recipes.title: Egg Croquettes
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe
